title: Business Process Data Analyst
description: <strong>Job Title: Business Process Data Analyst<br>Job Location: Des Plaines, IL<br>Duration: 4+ Months<br><br></strong><strong>Duties:</strong> <ul><li>Uses knowledge of software systems/databases/tools (i.e.; Navigator, Reliability, IDEA, Lotus Notes, Cognos) to provide support and service for data/process analysis reporting and tool development.</li><li>Develop data queries based upon adhoc reports required to measure effectiveness of business processes<br></li></ul><strong> Years Experience:<br></strong>4-6 years programming/data analysis Skills: Knowledge of Field Service Operations and call management systems AND experience with relational database and reporting tools.<br><br><strong>Education:</strong><ul><li>Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science OR equivalent work experience</li></ul>
description_json: <strong>Job Title: Business Process Data Analyst<br>Job Location: Des Plaines, IL<br>Duration: 4+ Months<br><br></strong><strong>Duties:</strong> <ul><li>Uses knowledge of software systems/databases/tools (i.e.; Navigator, Reliability, IDEA, Lotus Notes, Cognos) to provide support and service for data/process analysis reporting and tool development.</li><li>Develop data queries based upon adhoc reports required to measure effectiveness of business processes<br></li></ul><strong> Years Experience:<br></strong>4-6 years programming/data analysis Skills: Knowledge of Field Service Operations and call management systems AND experience with relational database and reporting tools.<br><br><strong>Education:</strong><ul><li>Bachelors Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science OR equivalent work experience</li></ul>

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and troubleshoots data integration solutions with complex data transformations and provides guidance to other team members</li><li>Influences other team members to achieve commitments per guidance from Chapter Leads and actively contributes to agile ceremonies</li><li>Demonstrates strong technical aptitude across data engineering practices</li><li>Utilizing variety of tools to profile, secure the data in transit and at rest; and to enforce data Governance Controls and Alerting</li><li>Designing advanced SQL queries</li><li>Leveraging metadata-driven framework for solutions</li><li>Developing test scripts for unit and integration testing</li><li>Develops test methodologies for specific products</li><li>Leads code review sessions and other process and operational improvement initiatives</li><li>Exhibits fluency with use of supplemental tools and technologies involved in data integration (Unix/Linux, TWS/Control-M or alike, BI stack)</li><li>Works on holistic solutions, driving feature and story delivery (Agile)</li><li>Identifies and effectively communicates upstream and downstream impacts for changes in the data pipeline</li><li>Participates in the on-call rotation for support</li><li>Demonstrates effective and clear communication in team and cross-functional meetings, and lead tech communities</li><li>Builds strong collaborative working relationship both within the team and cross-functionally</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li> 3+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration/Engineering</li><li> Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> ETL/ELT Tools (AbInitio, DataStage, Informatica)</li><li> Cloud Tools and Databases (AWS, Snowflake)</li><li> Other programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, etc.)</li><li> Leverage CI/CD framework for data integration, Open Source</li><li> Experience working in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)</li><li> Basic understanding of key infrastructure concepts (data centers as well as cloud hosting platform) to support business data needs</li><li> Experience optimizing SQL both relational and nosql</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Data Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong> DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> <strong>Data Engineer (</strong>multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining complex data solutions for the product. Mentor and influence peers to achieve commitments on data solutions on time and with quality. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field, and 36 months of experience in Sr. Associate - Projects or related.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: implementing cloud-based solutions and using Amazon Web Service (AWS) knowledge to provide cloud solutions in platform strategies; creating AWS serverless solutions for data conversion and unstructured data transfers; analyzing complex infrastructure data granularities, data visualization, iterative prototyping, and analysis tools to define architecture and develop high performance cloud-based solutions; working with large-scale data transformation and data modernization; and analyzing requirements and creating technical designs.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls.  Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><strong>Position Details:<br><br></strong>We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer for our Customer (CIM) Intelligence team. The team's primary mission is to build data analytics product by centralizing and integrating high-quality, trusted corporate data in a performant and scalable cloud analytical platform.<br><br>You will be responsible for helping design and develop data pipelines and the data product. You will work with SMEs, architects, analysts, data scientists and others to build solutions that integrate, process and store data from many of our internal and external enterprise data sources.<br><br><strong>You Will:<br></strong><ul><li> Enable analytics and reporting by centralizing and integrating high quality, large, complex data sets in a highly performant and scalable cloud analytical platform</li><li> Design, and implement data pipelines to ingest, cleanse and enrich data for analytics</li><li> Design and implement secure, performant data models to meet the scalability and performance needs of data product</li><li> Work with data scientists to enable data discovery and its curation for analytical purposes</li><li> Build frameworks, standards &amp; product features to enable self-service analytics</li><li> Partner with stakeholders including data, design, product and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues<br><br></li></ul><strong>You Have:<br></strong><ul><li> 5+ years of experience with Modern Data Engineering projects and practices: designing, building, and deploying scalable data pipelines</li><li> 3+ years of experience in designing building deploying cloud native solutions</li><li> 3+ years of experience with AWS, SQL, Python, Docker/Kubernetes, CI/CD, Git, familiarity with: Snowflake, DBT, AWS, Databricks, Apache Spark</li><li> Developed data products/systems using large and complex data sets to meet business and technical requirements</li><li> Experience mentoring junior team members as needed through design and development</li><li> Experience partnering with internal departments to establish requirements</li><li> Experience with advanced analytics and machine learning</li><li> Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI</li><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, information systems, or a related study or equivalent project-related experience<br><br></li></ul>
description_json: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><strong>Position Details:<br><br></strong>We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer for our Customer (CIM) Intelligence team. The team's primary mission is to build data analytics product by centralizing and integrating high-quality, trusted corporate data in a performant and scalable cloud analytical platform.<br><br>You will be responsible for helping design and develop data pipelines and the data product. You will work with SMEs, architects, analysts, data scientists and others to build solutions that integrate, process and store data from many of our internal and external enterprise data sources.<br><br><strong>You Will:<br></strong><ul><li> Enable analytics and reporting by centralizing and integrating high quality, large, complex data sets in a highly performant and scalable cloud analytical platform</li><li> Design, and implement data pipelines to ingest, cleanse and enrich data for analytics</li><li> Design and implement secure, performant data models to meet the scalability and performance needs of data product</li><li> Work with data scientists to enable data discovery and its curation for analytical purposes</li><li> Build frameworks, standards &amp; product features to enable self-service analytics</li><li> Partner with stakeholders including data, design, product and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues<br><br></li></ul><strong>You Have:<br></strong><ul><li> 5+ years of experience with Modern Data Engineering projects and practices: designing, building, and deploying scalable data pipelines</li><li> 3+ years of experience in designing building deploying cloud native solutions</li><li> 3+ years of experience with AWS, SQL, Python, Docker/Kubernetes, CI/CD, Git, familiarity with: Snowflake, DBT, AWS, Databricks, Apache Spark</li><li> Developed data products/systems using large and complex data sets to meet business and technical requirements</li><li> Experience mentoring junior team members as needed through design and development</li><li> Experience partnering with internal departments to establish requirements</li><li> Experience with advanced analytics and machine learning</li><li> Familiarity with BI tools such as Tableau, PowerBI</li><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, information systems, or a related study or equivalent project-related experience<br><br></li></ul>

Snowflake)</li><li>Other programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, etc.)</li><li>Leverage CI/CD framework for data integration, Open Source</li><li>Experience working in cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)</li><li>Basic understanding of key infrastructure concepts (data centers as well as cloud hosting platform) to support business data needs</li><li>Experience optimizing SQL both relational and nosql</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? title: Developer Associate
description: <strong>Department: </strong>Facilities Mgmt EV<p><br></p><strong>Salary/Grade: </strong>ITS/78<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting into the Facilities Finance and Administration group, the Developer, Associate joins a team of motivated and driven IT staff. Facilities is looking to a higher a talented individual with a strong desire to learn and develop new skills and work with new technologies. This is a great opportunity to get hands-on industry experience and work with different enterprise systems such as Tririga, OnBase and PeopleSoft Financials. In addition, this role completes maintenance on existing Facilities software products, assists in developing code, tests and debugging new software or making enhancements to existing software, writes programs according to design specifications from senior staff and internal customers and performs basic system integration tasks.<p><br></p>The role will support the department’s mission and values by exhibiting the following: inclusiveness, respect, initiative, collaboration, innovation, and accountability. The incumbent will strive to provide excellent service when performing job responsibilities and will practice safe work procedures and follow safety rules at all times.<p><br></p>Please note: Experience working in a University environment. Experience with support of Operations and/or Project Managers<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Strategic Planning </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Collaborates with user to develop work flow and best practices. </li><li> Assists in all stages of the project, starting from the initial planning stages. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Administration </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Responds to inquiries via phone, online, in-person, etc. </li><li> Creates and maintains software/process/support documentation. </li><li> Routes more complex requests for features/upgrades/changes to appropriate senior staff/management. </li><li> Participates in team/project meetings. </li><li> Identifies database and software performance issues and makes adjustments. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Development </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Assists with design, development, and maintenance. </li><li> Tests and debugs software. </li><li> Writes programs according to specifications from senior staff. </li><li> Codes software applications adhering to designs that support internal business requirements or external user. </li><li> Competes tier 3 troubleshooting. </li><li> Develops reports. </li><li> Prioritizes assigned tasks. </li><li> Opens help tickets with vendors. </li></ul><p><br></p><em> Miscellaneous </em><p><br></p><ul><li> Performs other duties as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong>    <ul><li> Successful completion of a full 4-year course of study in an accredited college or university leading to a bachelor's or higher degree in a major such as computer science, information technology, or related; OR appropriate combination of education and experience. </li><li> No experience required. </li><li> Please see information highlighted below.</li><ul><li> Infrastructure</li><ul><li> SQL/MySQL/Postgres </li></ul><li> Programming Languages and Frameworks</li><ul><li> .Net </li><li> C# </li><li> CSS </li><li> HTML 5 </li><li> JavaScript </li><li> JQuery </li><li> PL/SQL </li></ul><li> Analytical</li><ul><li> Database design/data structure </li><li> Problem solving </li></ul></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong> Minimum Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities.) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent communications skills, both oral and written. </li><li> Excellent organizational and problem solving skills. </li><li> Team Player: ability to build effective collaboration and trust in a team environment. </li><li> Multi-tasking: ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously </li><li> Attention to detail: must be able to manage a project and maintain accuracy while working on tasks. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience working in a University environment </li><li> Experience with support of Operations and/or Project Managers </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Preferred Competencies: (Skills, knowledge, and abilities) </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with databases </li><li> Experience with Onbase, Work Order Management Systems (IWMS) </li></ul><strong> <strong> Benefits: <br><br></strong>At Northwestern, we are proud to provide meaningful, competitive, high-quality health care plans, retirement benefits, tuition discounts and more! Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/index.html to learn more. </strong><strong> <strong> Work-Life and Wellness: <br><br></strong>Northwestern offers comprehensive programs and services to help you and your family navigate life’s challenges and opportunities, and adopt and maintain healthy lifestyles.<br><br>We support flexible work arrangements where possible and programs to help you locate and pay for quality, affordable childcare and senior/adult care. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/benefits/work-life/index.html to learn more. </strong><strong> <strong> Professional Growth &amp; Development: <br><br></strong>Northwestern supports employee career development in all circumstances whether your workspace is on campus or at home. If you’re interested in developing your professional potential or continuing your formal education, we offer a variety of tools and resources. Visit us at https://www.northwestern.edu/hr/learning/index.html to learn more. <br><br></strong>Northwestern strongly recommends COVID-19 vaccinations and boosters for people who can obtain them as a critical tool for minimizing severe illness. More information can be found on the COVID-19 and Campus Updates webpage.<br><br><em>The Northwestern campus sits on the traditional homelands of the people of the Council of Three Fires, the Ojibwe, Potawatomi, and Odawa as well as the Menominee, Miami and Ho-Chunk nations. We acknowledge and honor the original people of the land upon which Northwestern University stands, and the Native people who remain on this land today.<br><br></em><em>Northwestern University is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer of all protected classes, including veterans and individuals with disabilities. Women, racial and ethnic minorities, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are encouraged to apply. Click for information on EEO is the Law.<br><br></em>

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description: Since 1952, Lawson Products has worked hard to make our customers' jobs easier by improving their operational efficiency, productivity and overall performance. As a leader in the MRO industry, we partner with customers to make sure they have the right maintenance and repair parts on hand when needed.<p><br></p>We’re looking for a motivated Data Warehouse Developer responsible for preparing corporate data for reporting and analysis using the relational database and OLAP technologies. This position will analyze and develop complex logical database designs, logical data models and relational data definitions in support of corporate and customer information systems requirements.<p><br></p>Our corporate headquarters is located in Chicago, IL. This role operates on a hybrid work model, spending at least three days per week working in the office. We offer a competitive benefits package that includes 401k plus vision, dental and medical coverage. Employees also receive a paid holiday and PTO package.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develops data models to meet the needs of Lawson's information systems. Responsible for the identification and resolution of information flow, content issues and the transformation of business requirements into logical data models. </li><li> Designs and develops ETL solutions using SAP Data Services. </li><li> Manages the flow of information between departments through relational databases. </li><li> Maintains data integrity by reducing data redundancy, trends in data use and single sources of data. </li><li> Stays current on the ways Lawson uses its data. </li><li> Mentors junior development resources. </li><li> Supports and maintains existing ETL data flows and the data warehouse environment. </li><li> Other duties, as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications &amp; Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Requires a bachelor's degree, plus 5 years of experience in data modeling and development, or an equivalent combination of education and experience </li><li> Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. </li><li> Business Objects or other enterprise BI suite experience a plus. </li><li> 5-7 years of ETL development experience. SAP Data Services experience preferred. </li><li> In-depth understanding and demonstrated proficiency in data warehousing concepts, best practices, and dimensional database design. </li><li> Cross-functional experience with sales, human resources, finance or operations. </li><li> Understands the methodologies and technologies that depict the flow of data within and between technology systems and business functions/operations. </li></ul><p><br></p>Lawson Products is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Linux Engineer
description: Opportunity to work for a proprietary global market maker, trading on major financial markets around the world. As a member of the Systems Engineering team you’ll be instrumental in an environment of continuous improvement, providing and guaranteeing a stable platform for trading systems.<br><br>Strong industry salary based on experience and interview<br><br>401K w/ match, FULLY paid health insurance, paid commute<br><br>25 days paid vacation<br><ul><li>3+ years of experience with Linux</li><li>Great communication</li><li>Excellent scripting skills, preferably with Python<br></li></ul>

title: Hybrid Database Analyst 29353
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Solving IT International Inc, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>One of the largest health insurers in the nation is focused on continuously building an industry-defining, world-class IT capability. Healthcare is forever evolving, especially due to emerging technologies, making this a great experience to add to your resume. Come join their winning team!<p><br></p>This <strong>Contract-to-Hire </strong> role as a <strong>Database Analyst</strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong> will be responsible for designing and developing applications, databases and reports based on long-term business strategy including major enhancements to existing functionality and user tools. This is a <strong>Hybrid</strong> role, 3 day onsite, 2 days remote.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop, maintain, and enhance complex databases used for a variety of areas and functions using SQL, VB, VBA, Access, Excel and other software as applicable. </li><li> Work with users to capture and analyze business and data requirements necessary to meet business needs and corporate strategies/goals. </li><li> Write programs, develop and maintain distributed architecture databases for major corporate functions and develop required reporting. </li><li> Evaluate and recommend to management appropriate hardware/software platform upgrades. </li><li> Maintain documentation of all requests, data parameters and reports in an accurate and accessible manner. </li><li> Streamline reporting as much as possible by automating queries, etc. and/or placing reports in production to minimize manual efforts. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree and 5 years experience in areas of information technology and 2 years of relevant database and application development experience. Requires advanced to expert level knowledge and understanding of database and application systems design and interfaces. </li><li> 3 years experience in SQL programming. </li><li> Thorough knowledge of PC windows-based applications, including Excel, Access, and VBA. </li><li> Skills to anticipate additional reporting parameters and confirm requirements as needed. </li><li> Interprets business issues and recommends business solutions. </li><li> Takes initiative to solves complex problems that have a far-reaching impact on the business. </li><li> Works independently with minimal guidance. </li><li> Verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills necessary to work in team environment. </li><li> Organizational skills and experience managing completion of multiple projects. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor s degree with concentration in Business, Math or Computer Science. </li><li> Experience with Tableau and SharePoint. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits: </strong><p><br></p>Solving IT is pleased to offer a rich benefit plan to our W2 employees. We offer five health plan options and a PPO dental plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield, Term Life/AD&amp;D Insurance, and 401(k) Savings Plan. Solving IT subsidizes the health and dental premium for the employee.<p><br></p>As you continue to develop your skills and experience, Solving IT will work with your changing preferences to match you with rewarding projects. Our unrivaled reputation for quality is demonstrated through our Inavero Best of Staffing award that was won due to the feedback from our own clients and candidates. We also love to socialize and have fun so we have regularly scheduled parties and events for you to unwind and network with fellow consultants.<p><br></p>Whether you are searching for your next challenge or just looking to stay on top of market trends, Solving IT is committed to help position you appropriately. By leveraging the latest market and compensation data available, you can rest assured that you are getting more than just an informed opinion. You are getting the Solving IT Experience.<p><br></p>Hybrid Database Analyst 29353<p><br></p>

title: Systems Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Metra is one of the largest and most complex commuter rail systems in North America, serving Cook, DuPage, Will, Lake, Kane, and McHenry Counties. The agency is linking communities in Northeastern Illinois by providing safe, reliable, and efficient commuter service.<p><br></p>Information Technology is divided into four sections: Enterprise Applications, Railroad Applications, Network Services and Systems Development. The Enterprise Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used enterprise-wide at Metra, such as the new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and HR, Payroll and Timekeeping systems. The Railroad Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used to support Metra’s Transportation, Mechanical, and Engineering functions. The Network Services section has two distinct groups: IT Support and Network Operations. IT Support maintains and supports the agency’s personal computers as well as computer aided design (CAD) systems for the Engineering Department and point-of-sale terminals. Network Operations builds and maintains the servers and storage that are replacing the agency’s mainframe, the data network, e-mail system and disaster recovery capabilities. Systems Development develops, maintains and supports all application systems built in-house, across all business functions.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Manager, Network Services, Systems Engineers install, maintain, and monitor servers and storage infrastructure equipment and software; analyze service options, server and storage infrastructure configurations, and ongoing support requirements to improve system reliability and maintain operations metrics; and maintain infrastructure equipment with current vendor support agreements.<p><br></p>The primary duties include provide level 1 and level 2 support for multiple technologies, primarily Microsoft windows servers including domain controllers, and Exchange servers; and function as administrator for the Active Directory, Azure, VMWare vSphere environment, and storage area networks (SAN). Install, configure, and maintain server hardware, storage area networks (SAN), and system software for all Information Technology (IT) applications and devices.<p><br></p>Support Level 1 and Level 2 technical support staff in resolving complex issues. Collaborate with team members to automate management tasks and streamline processes. Perform Windows Server virtualization implementation, support, and upgrades. Assist in resolving network server or infrastructure problems and manage performance and capacity issues. Perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Candidates can expect salary offers that range from <u>the minimum to the mid-point</u> of the salary range. </strong>Metra provides full pay ranges so candidate can consider their growth potential.<p><br></p>Metra is a railroad employer subject to the provisions of the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, not the Social Security Administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer related discipline, engineering, or in lieu of degree, any combination of education and work experience may be substituted for the required degree that equals four (4) years in Information Technology infrastructure and networking services.</li><li>In addition to #1, must have six (6) years progressive responsible IT experience that includes: Microsoft network engineering (hardware and software); deploying current releases of Microsoft servers including: database and email servers; configuring and deploying VMware virtualization technology; developing, managing, and maintaining backup and recovery systems; and, at least three (3) years planning, implementing, and managing large scale Storage Area Networks (SANS).</li><li>Considerable knowledge of of VMware virtualization and associated software. </li><li>Good knowledge of of Microsoft technologies and protocols. </li><li>Good knowledge of monitoring tools used for both internal and external-facing systems.</li><li>Knowledge of backup and recovery systems including setting up disaster recovery for server and storage infrastructures for an enterprise environment.</li><li>Proficient in configuring current releases of Microsoft servers, Active Directory, Azure, DNS and DHCP. </li><li>Proficient in configuring, managing, and troubleshooting Exchange servers.</li><li>Strong analytical and organization skills with attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills when interacting with users, management, and consultants. </li><li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize multiple objectives, and bring projects to completion.</li><li>Ability to work independently.</li><li>MCSE or VMware certification preferred. CCNP helpful. </li><li>Must possess and maintain a valid driver's license and able to operate a motor vehicle.</li><li>Ability to stand, walk, and/or sit, for extended periods of time. </li><li>Hearing/Visual acuity, far/near, depth perception, field of vision, color vision.</li><li>Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds. </li><li>Must be willing to travel within and outside of Metra’s 6-county region. </li><li>Must be available to work flexible hours in the early morning, late afternoon, evenings, or weekends.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>On May 11, 2023, both the state of IL and the federal government will put an end to the COVID-19 emergency measures. Effective May 11, 2023 Metra's COVID vaccine requirements will be suspended until further notice.</strong><p><br></p>Please note: Regardless of any state laws that legalize marijuana, Metra prohibits applicants and employees’ use or possession of marijuana (or marijuana paraphernalia), or having detectable amounts of marijuana in their bodies, including synthetic and/or non-synthetic substances such as THC for any reason for preemployment screening purposes, while on duty, subject to duty, on Metra property, or in Metra work equipment and vehicles.<p><br></p>Metra is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is our policy to fill vacant positions with qualified candidates without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or any protected categories, assuming an individual can perform the essential functions of the job with or without accommodation.
description_json: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Metra is one of the largest and most complex commuter rail systems in North America, serving Cook, DuPage, Will, Lake, Kane, and McHenry Counties. The agency is linking communities in Northeastern Illinois by providing safe, reliable, and efficient commuter service.<p><br></p>Information Technology is divided into four sections: Enterprise Applications, Railroad Applications, Network Services and Systems Development. The Enterprise Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used enterprise-wide at Metra, such as the new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and HR, Payroll and Timekeeping systems. The Railroad Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used to support Metra’s Transportation, Mechanical, and Engineering functions. The Network Services section has two distinct groups: IT Support and Network Operations. IT Support maintains and supports the agency’s personal computers as well as computer aided design (CAD) systems for the Engineering Department and point-of-sale terminals. Network Operations builds and maintains the servers and storage that are replacing the agency’s mainframe, the data network, e-mail system and disaster recovery capabilities. Systems Development develops, maintains and supports all application systems built in-house, across all business functions.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Manager, Network Services, Systems Engineers install, maintain, and monitor servers and storage infrastructure equipment and software; analyze service options, server and storage infrastructure configurations, and ongoing support requirements to improve system reliability and maintain operations metrics; and maintain infrastructure equipment with current vendor support agreements.<p><br></p>The primary duties include provide level 1 and level 2 support for multiple technologies, primarily Microsoft windows servers including domain controllers, and Exchange servers; and function as administrator for the Active Directory, Azure, VMWare vSphere environment, and storage area networks (SAN). Install, configure, and maintain server hardware, storage area networks (SAN), and system software for all Information Technology (IT) applications and devices.<p><br></p>Support Level 1 and Level 2 technical support staff in resolving complex issues. Collaborate with team members to automate management tasks and streamline processes. Perform Windows Server virtualization implementation, support, and upgrades. Assist in resolving network server or infrastructure problems and manage performance and capacity issues. Perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Candidates can expect salary offers that range from <u>the minimum to the mid-point</u> of the salary range. </strong>Metra provides full pay ranges so candidate can consider their growth potential.<p><br></p>Metra is a railroad employer subject to the provisions of the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, not the Social Security Administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer related discipline, engineering, or in lieu of degree, any combination of education and work experience may be substituted for the required degree that equals four (4) years in Information Technology infrastructure and networking services.</li><li>In addition to #1, must have six (6) years progressive responsible IT experience that includes: Microsoft network engineering (hardware and software); deploying current releases of Microsoft servers including: database and email servers; configuring and deploying VMware virtualization technology; developing, managing, and maintaining backup and recovery systems; and, at least three (3) years planning, implementing, and managing large scale Storage Area Networks (SANS).</li><li>Considerable knowledge of of VMware virtualization and associated software. </li><li>Good knowledge of of Microsoft technologies and protocols. </li><li>Good knowledge of monitoring tools used for both internal and external-facing systems.</li><li>Knowledge of backup and recovery systems including setting up disaster recovery for server and storage infrastructures for an enterprise environment.</li><li>Proficient in configuring current releases of Microsoft servers, Active Directory, Azure, DNS and DHCP. </li><li>Proficient in configuring, managing, and troubleshooting Exchange servers.</li><li>Strong analytical and organization skills with attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills when interacting with users, management, and consultants. </li><li>Ability to multi-task, prioritize multiple objectives, and bring projects to completion.</li><li>Ability to work independently.</li><li>MCSE or VMware certification preferred. CCNP helpful. </li><li>Must possess and maintain a valid driver's license and able to operate a motor vehicle.</li><li>Ability to stand, walk, and/or sit, for extended periods of time. </li><li>Hearing/Visual acuity, far/near, depth perception, field of vision, color vision.</li><li>Ability to lift and move up to 50 pounds. </li><li>Must be willing to travel within and outside of Metra’s 6-county region. </li><li>Must be available to work flexible hours in the early morning, late afternoon, evenings, or weekends.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>On May 11, 2023, both the state of IL and the federal government will put an end to the COVID-19 emergency measures. Effective May 11, 2023 Metra's COVID vaccine requirements will be suspended until further notice.</strong><p><br></p>Please note: Regardless of any state laws that legalize marijuana, Metra prohibits applicants and employees’ use or possession of marijuana (or marijuana paraphernalia), or having detectable amounts of marijuana in their bodies, including synthetic and/or non-synthetic substances such as THC for any reason for preemployment screening purposes, while on duty, subject to duty, on Metra property, or in Metra work equipment and vehicles.<p><br></p>Metra is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is our policy to fill vacant positions with qualified candidates without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or any protected categories, assuming an individual can perform the essential functions of the job with or without accommodation.

title: Associate IT Server and Cloud Computing Engineer (Remote Opportunity)
description: <strong>Job Locations <br><br></strong>US-VA-Smithfield<br><br>US-IL-Lisle<br><br>US-MO-Kansas City<br><br><strong> Your Opportunity <br><br></strong>Are you an Information Technology professional looking for a fast-paced, challenging and transformational environment, where you can make a difference? Smithfield Foods, one of the country’s top consumer packaged goods companies, is looking for you! Our Information Technology and Transformation (IT&amp;T) team is searching for focused and driven candidates who are excited about communicating new ideas and delivering first-class technical solutions to meet the demands of a growing business. We foster a culture that values everyone's creativity, our environment and the communities in which we live.<br><br>The IT Associate Engineer Server and Cloud Computing will be involved in cloud and server operations, design and build of innovative solutions to bring value. Responsible for the support and maintenance of company-wide deployment of cloud and server technology and standards, orchestration of build – service processes, administration, and monitoring capabilities. This position will collaborate with other IT teams and vendors to design and implement technical solutions that align to the Infrastructure strategy, management and governance of business processes and operations with the implementation of infrastructure services.<br><br><strong><u>Core Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Provide technical guidance and participate on implementation teams deploying new systems and operational processes in accordance with strategic business initiatives and approved projects </li><li> Assists IT Engineers and other IT Leaders in the development of detailed implementation and contingency plans </li><li> Share input and recommendations to innovate current state by employing performance tuning activities while monitoring, and troubleshoot problems that may arise </li><li> Provides technical and administrative support for daily operations for both on-premise and cloud systems </li><li> Analyze and evaluate existing or proposed systems and solution for compliance with security, performance, reliability, and scalability working with IT Engineers </li><li> Participates in the research and evaluation of new enterprise technologies, processes, upgrades to platform infrastructure solutions and enhancements </li><li> Participate in the strategy, management and governance of IT process and operations with the implementation of infrastructure services. </li><li> Create and maintain documentation of compute services reference and training fellow team members <br></li></ul>The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions .<br><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree from a regionally accredited four-year college or university and 2+ years of relevant experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience, required. </li><li> Established technical knowledge and 2+ years of hands-on experience in either Windows or Linux Server administration, both a plus (Red Hat Linux a plus) </li><li> Technical understanding of hyperconverged solutions </li><li> Technical knowledge or hands on experience with Active Directory, ADFS, SCCM, VMWare, Cisco UCS, Veeam, and Red Hat Satellite Server </li><li> Experience working with multi cloud enterprises environments and understanding of capabilities and service cost structures of major providers (Azure and AWS Plus) </li><li> Experience in finding root causes of problems, quickly determine efficient solutions </li><li> Ability to analyze, translate, and define business requirements into technical solutions </li><li> Knowledge of orchestration tools to automate processes and services </li><li> Knowledge of operational characteristics of infrastructure services, systems, hardware and software </li><li> Ability to adapt to changing technologies and learn functionality of new equipment and systems </li><li> Work independently in the absence of supervision </li><li> Self-motivated, analytical, and possessing excellent problem-solving and follow-through skills </li><li> Knowledge of principles, methods and techniques used in the installation, troubleshooting and maintenance of server and cloud infrastructure and application impacts and dependencies </li><li> Excellent organizational, technical, and business communication skills </li><li> Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment. </li><li> Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.</li></ul>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Are you interested in working with the largest independent software testing company? Read on!<p><br></p>Qualitest is looking for a SCADA Data Maintenance Engineer in Oakbrook Terrace, IL to join our team!<p><br></p>The SCADA Data Maintenance Engineer performs critical activities relating to designing, building, testing, implementing and maintaining SCADA solutions, products and processes.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Possess the necessary level of knowledge and skills of SCADA/EMS-related real-time, historian, and relational databases for SCADA system support and data maintenance with a high -level understanding of complex power systems and design</li><li>Analyze, integrate, and maintain real-time Intelligent Electronic Devices (IED’s) and computer systems in SCADA</li><li>Resolve complex SCADA and telecommunications problems with the RTUs, ICCP links, and the SCADA/EMS networks and associated equipment in a timely manner. Must have a firm technical understanding and educational background of sub-systems to effectively troubleshoot and solve complicated and/or inter-related issues</li><li>Perform engineering duties to improve telecommunications/IP reliability and support the operations of end-to-end communication networks to exchange data with a variety of devices</li><li>Learn all facets of SCADA system and perform work in an independent manner as well as in a team environment as the job requires</li><li>Communicate effectively and build strong relationships with team members and customers including TSO/DSO leadership and operators, EMS/SCADA vendors, contractors and consultants, Field Operations personnel Substations, Electric System Planning and Substation Engineering on technical and business tasks</li><li>Apply technical knowledge and experience to identify options, costs and benefits</li><li>Work on new systems but also support and maintain existing installations. Provide thorough factory and site acceptance testing and documentation</li><li>Translate requirements into clear, concise documentation for scalable, robust and flexible designs</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in writing SQL scripts in Oracle/MySQL/SQL</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Access</li><li>A minimum of a bachelor’s degree in IT related technical field (MIS, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, etc)</li><li>Ability to translate operational requirements and visualize the electrical network state into database configuration</li><li>Ability to produce high quality deliverables while maintaining schedule commitments</li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li><li>Ability to communicate well and quickly to troubleshoot problems</li><li>Strong business ethics</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong>  <strong>Intrigued to find more about us?</strong> <strong>If you like what you have read, send us your resume and let’s start talking!</strong> <ul><li> Why Qualitest?</li><ul><li>Be a part of a company who strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences. We have more than 40% women and around 120 different nationalities.</li><li>Local and global opportunities – we offer you internal rotation and international mobility opportunities to grow your career.</li><li>Clear view of your career and progression with the company – Qualitest is growing massively (since 2021 – tripled our employees base – we now have more than 8,000 engineers) and giving you the opportunity to grow with us.</li><li>Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture. Take a break from work and join an employee event, or enjoy the amenities and games provided from one of our Employees Centers.Save your earnings and prepare for your future by enrolling in our 401k plan where Qualitest will match your contributions accelerating your savings plan.</li><li>Take care of health with enrollment into one of our competitive healthcare benefits. Qualitest will match towards your HSA if you choose to participate.</li><li>Never stop experimenting and learning with QCraft – our Learning &amp; Development platform: 50,000+ courses, 300+ virtual labs, mentorship and leadership programs, professional tribes, sponsored certifications, and much more.</li><li>Stay active and get rewarded with our Corporate Wellness Program. We pay your Gym membership and giving you opportunities to Earn additional vacation times for attendance the gym!</li><li>We invest in our Senior Engineers and leaders with our Equity program.</li><li>Earn bonuses via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Program’s. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth.</li><ul><li>We recognize our employees work via our Qudos platform - You can earn bonuses and spot awards by celebrating your and your peers’ achievements.</li><li>Planning a vacation? Looking for car insurance? Get access to Qualitest Employee Perks for discounts on anything from travel to electronics. With so many offerings the savings are endless!</li><li>A Competitive pay, the salary range for the role is $55,000 - $75,000.</li><li>Visit our website at www.qualitestgroup.com</li><li>Check out our Career page: https://qualitestgroup.com/careers/</li></ul></ul></ul>

title: SCADA Data Maintenance Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC <p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong>                     Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong>       Riverwoods, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills, and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home is permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Senior Systems Engineer; IT Analyst or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position Required Skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: participating in Hadoop data cluster engineering and administration for high availability, replications and disaster recovery solutions; performing Big Data cluster security implementation; and utilizing technologies including Kafka, Storm, Spark, Zookeeper, NiFi, HBase, HDFS, Hive, Yarn, Ranger, Knox, Ambari and Kerberos.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $101,500 - $171,500. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Responsible for coordinating data needs across all value streams and providing insight and support into data enhancements and improvements identified by gap analyses. The roles will require thought leadership and, at times, solution architecture skills, as well as various technical experiences including data generation, data scrubbing, data provisioning, data obfuscation, and solutions and designing of data architecture and engineering enhancements in distributed environments<p><br></p><strong>Position: Test Data Management Engineer-C2C</strong><p><br></p><strong>Start Date: 7/4/2023</strong><p><br></p><strong>End Date: 6/30/2024</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Riverwoods, Illinois</strong><p><br></p><strong>Position: Onsite</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Technical solid knowledge of Optim and GenRocket</li><li>Competent understanding of Test Data Management related to data security, data masking, synthetic data creation and test data strategy planning.</li><li>Experience on DB migration/consolidation projects</li><li>Exceptional analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.</li><li>Excellent spoken and written communication to explain the methods to a technical and non-technical audience.</li><li>The ability to think laterally and 'outside the box.'</li><li>Teamwork skills, to support colleagues and share techniques.</li><li>Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and the persistence to apply different techniques to get the job done.</li><li>Competent in TDM functions like data masking, data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, data mining, data handling, data management and synthetic data creation, APIs, Macros</li><li>Collaborates with subject matter experts and data stewards to identify PII definitions, data strategies, policies, controls, and programs to ensure enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.</li><li>Reviewing data needs and driving data solutioning decisions. Ability to build data masking configurations in the data masking tools. Provide mentoring to Test Data Analysts as needed.</li></ul>

title: Test Data Management Engineer
description: <strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Evaluate, architect, and participate in the implementation of new and existing technologies, services and platforms supporting the corporate technology infrastructure.</li><li>Anticipate and remediate issues, react to problems, and prioritize actions to maintain reliable technology infrastructure operations 24/7/365.</li><li>Ensure high availability of the enterprise technology infrastructure, and assist with capacity planning and risk management activities including evaluating alternatives for resiliency and redundancy, and developing disaster recovery solutions.</li><li>Design and support network and voice-over-IP infrastructure, including wide area and local area networks, MPLS, VPN, firewalls, switches, routers, and associated monitoring tools.</li><li>Perform upgrades and patch management activities on a timely basis for critical technology infrastructure including firewalls, network devices, servers, storage devices, and VMWare.</li><li>Tune and optimize performance, monitor and react to issues with technology assets, including servers and storage, local and wide area network, operating systems and application software.</li><li>Serve as primary point of contact for IT service providers.</li><li>Monitor industry trends, identify opportunities to improve performance, reduce cost, simplify the environment, and/or reduce risk; make recommendations and prepare proposals and plans for implementation.</li><li>Develop and document standards, policies and procedures, and follow best practices for change management to ensure a stable predictable environment.</li><li>Share knowledge and experience with other IT team members, be willing to learn new things.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Professional Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or technology-related degree, or equivalent experience.</li><li>3-5 years of experience configuring, managing, supporting, monitoring, maintaining multi-site enterprise TCP/IP networks, including MPLS, VPN, firewalls, VOIP, and wireless technologies.</li><li>3-5 years of experience administering and supporting VMWare virtualization solutions in an enterprise environment, including vCenter, HA, DRS, scripting and disaster recovery.</li><li>3- 5 years of experience managing infrastructure for Microsoft Windows Server and SUSE Linux.</li><li>3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Windows Server technology including Azure AD, Active Directory, DFS, DHCP, DNS, RDS, GPOs, PowerShell, software deployment tools and security.</li><li>3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS).</li><li>Experience managing data storage environments, including SANs, provisioning LUNS and real time replication.</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of technology infrastructure security concepts, including Azure AD, Web Application Firewalls, penetration testing, vulnerability management, application code scanning, and data loss prevention.</li><li>Experience in a 24/7/365 work schedule environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Personal Attributes</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated efficient and effective use of problem-solving and task prioritization to solve complex challenges and deal with high pressure situations.</li><li>Strong understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.</li><li>Proven project management skills.</li><li>Excellent communication skills and experience effectively communicating with technical and non-technical audiences.</li><li>Highly self-motivated and directed.</li><li>Strong organizational skills.</li><li>Excellent attention to detail.</li><li>Able to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>RTC is an equal-opportunity employer. Women, individuals of all ethnicities, people with disabilities (intellectual and physical), and Veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), age (40 or older), disability or genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, religion or any other basis prohibited by law.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>About RTC</u></strong><p><br></p><em>RTC focuses on continual improvement, evolving our capabilities, and reinvesting in our business to deliver higher-performing solutions for our clients. Brands and retailers require more strategic thinking on the shopper experience, higher levels of innovation, a more effective process for managing customer-specific requirements, access to a broader array of manufactured solutions, and the capability to orchestrate a broader and more complex supply chain. RTC has the integrated capabilities and product development experience to solve these needs and provide you with solutions that help grow your business in retail. </em>Learn more at http://www.rtc.com/.<p><br></p><em>Information about RTC and our benefits are listed here and details about the job opening are below.</em><p><br></p><strong>Why should you consider a career at RTC?</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>401(K) Plan with company match (we also offer a Roth option!</li><li>Hybrid work from home program offered</li><li>Health Insurance through Blue Cross Blue Shield (choose from two PPO plans and one HMO plan based on your deductible comfort level)</li><li>Dental Insurance with two plan options (both PPO Plans)</li><li>Flexible Spending for Health and/or Dependent Care</li><li>Commuter Transit benefit</li><li>Critical illness benefit</li><li>Life Insurance (we cover 3 times your salary - you can purchase more)</li><li>Short-Term Disability Coverage (we'll cover this for you too - you can choose to purchase long-term disability)</li><li>2 weeks of paid Parental Leave</li><li>16 PTO Days (full year)</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Tuition Assistance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Perks</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Fun Friday Hours - get a head start on your weekend by leaving at 2:30 every Friday (year-round!)</li><li>Volunteer Time Off (VTO) plus company-sponsored volunteer events.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Wellness</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>PTO is encouraged not only for vacations but mental health breaks.</li><li>Work/Life resources such as Legal, Financial, and Counseling are available through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Discounts to eligible fitness centers for associates enrolled with Blue Cross.</li><li>Preventative Care is covered at 100% (annual check-ups and screenings).</li><li>Lactation rooms are available for new mothers at Rolling Meadows location.</li><li>Annual flu clinic at Romeoville and Rolling Meadows for our associates and any dependents covered on our health plan. Flu shots are covered by insurance if associate elects to go elsewhere.</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Career Development &amp; Training </strong></em><p><br></p>We encourage your professional growth and development. We offer mentors with deep industry experience, and management who will assist you in defining and realizing your short and long term career goals and a variety of opportunities for training and advancement.

We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong>                     Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)  <p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong>       Riverwoods, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Infrastructure Developer Specialist; Senior Infrastructure Developer; Tech Lead; Technical Lead or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: providing technical direction in design, implementation, and maintenance of CI/CD platform components, including Jenkins, GitHub, Nexus, and SonarQube; developing and releasing infrastructure as a code with DevOps methodology for automation; working with Docker and Kubernetes to create highly available and scalable CI/CD solutions; designing and implementing backup and disaster strategies for CI/CD tools; developing self-service utilities to perform CICD tool administrative activities; providing best practices to address any audit and security issues; and designing and configuring automation scripts to monitor CI/CD tool infrastructure resources and its availability.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <p><strong>A BIT ABOUT SIBEL HEALTH:</strong></p><p>With headquarters based in Chicago, Illinois and an international office in Seoul, South Korea, Sibel Health is an award-winning digital health startup with a mission to deliver Better Health Data for All®. We were founded with a specific focus on our most vulnerable patients—pregnant persons and babies—where we believe wireless monitoring has the potential to do the most good worldwide. We achieve this by providing a complete monitoring solution of advanced wireless wearables, best in class software, and novel AI/ML algorithms all linked to the cloud. To date, we’ve launched our technologies in 20 countries from the most advanced hospitals in the world to the most resource constrained locations. We work with some of the most respected healthcare organizations in the world from major philanthropies to large medical technology and pharmaceutical companies. With numerous FDA clearances and a recently completed fundraising round, we are poised for growth and expansion. We are seeking mission-driven individuals with a strong sense of purpose who believe that technology can improve the lives of our most vulnerable patients.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY:</strong></p><p>We are looking for a <strong>Solutions Engineer</strong> to join our team. You will work with hardware, application, and other cross-functional teams to react quickly and produce quality solutions to difficult technical challenges. Sibel’s fast-paced environment offers ample opportunities for growth in several areas: improved technology skills, effective leadership, dedicated mentorship, creative design, strong communication skills, teamwork, and more.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL BE WORKING ON:</strong></p><ul><li>Manage customer deployments of our patient monitoring solutions, including training healthcare professionals, ensuring high-quality implementations.</li><li>Monitor active customer deployments of our products, assure system operation and performance, and anticipate and resolve any issues.</li><li>Create and deliver deployment, service, and maintenance manuals and documentation.</li><li>Prepare, coordinate, and track outgoing shipments for customer projects.</li><li>Act as the main point of contact for external product training, product demonstrations, and troubleshooting both virtually and on-site.</li><li>Develop and implement relevant Standard Operating Procedures and Assembly Build Instructions.</li><li>Coordinate with product management and product development teams to communicate customer needs and potential product improvements.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>ABOUT YOU:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field.</li><li>Proven experience as a Solutions Engineer or a similar role in a technology-driven industry.</li><li>Excellent understanding of product deployment, monitoring, and troubleshooting processes.</li><li>Ability to create and deliver effective training and product demonstrations to customers.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and quality focus.</li><li>Strong communication and customer-facing skills.</li><li>Willingness to travel internationally for on-site product deployment, training, and troubleshooting.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>BENEFITS:</strong></p><ul><li>Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance</li><li>"Take as much time as you need" policy</li><li>Simple IRA plan with employer matching</li><li>Company sponsored events and lunches</li><li>Stipend for professional development</li><li>Opportunity to be part of a dedicated and driven team that is here to disrupt and revolutionize wireless monitoring</li></ul><p><br></p><p><em>Sibel Health Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.</em></p>
