title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong><u>Department</u></strong><p><br></p>Provost Globus Software Engineering 1<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>Globus (www.globus.org) is a sustainable, non-profit business within The University of Chicago delivering solutions to the research community worldwide. Globus develops and provides critical services that support scientific research for governmental, academic, and commercial organizations in a wide range of disciplines including life sciences, physics, and astronomy. We develop, operate, and sell commercial-quality, cloud-based software application and platform services used by 10s of thousands of researchers to manage their large–and growing–data management challenges. We have offices located at 401 North Michigan Ave. in the heart of downtown Chicago, and remote employees who work-from-home.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Software Development Manager, the focus of this position is to build identity and access management systems for Globus Software as a Service (SaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) products using Python. As a member of the platform team, your work will support researchers worldwide by delivering key security solutions that underpin the Globus research data management services, and a platform that secures applications and clients across a diverse research ecosystem.<p><br></p>We're looking for Python engineers to create, operate, and integrate identity management services through the use of modern technologies and techniques from Web and Cloud computing. This role is perfect if you are interested in tackling the challenges of improving online security and privacy management while simplifying usability.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Software Development: Develop, test, document, deploy and maintain high-quality software, including REST interfaces, command-line interfaces, email and messaging services, and identity provider integrations. </li><li>Architecture and Design: Participates in the definition and documentation of requirements, architecture and design of secure, scalable, asynchronous, data access services, based on knowledge of principles of API design, asynchronous processes, service deployment and delivering highly available services. </li><li>Support and Documentation: Work in close collaboration with the Globus front line support and professional services teams, and directly with end users, to provide technical support services. Document standard operating procedures and protocols.</li><li>Team Coordination: Contribute to team coordination and development activities, including participating in Scrum ceremonies and peer reviews. Develop knowledge of current security best practices. </li><li>Investigates and resolves day-to-day technical problems using standard procedures. </li><li>Performs code testing on components and works to ensure that appropriate implementation standards are met. </li><li>Performs other related work as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></u><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through &lt; 2 years of work experience in a related job discipline.<br><li><br></li><strong><u>Certifications<br><br></u></strong><u><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></strong></u><strong><u>Education<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science or another relevant computer related field.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>Relevant programming experience developing, implementing, and debugging Python for personal or professional projects.</li><li>Contributing to an open source project.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Technical Skills Or Knowledge<br></u></strong><ul><li>Familiarity with Python web framework (e.g. Flask/Django).</li><li>Knowledge of SQL databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite).</li><li>Knowledge of Web technologies (e.g. Javascript, HTML, CSS).</li><li>Unit testing and continuous integration tools (e.g. pytest, Jenkins, Github Actions).</li><li>Familiarity with Shell scripting (e.g., bash).</li><li>Knowledge of Agile (e.g. Scrum) development processes.</li><li>Use standard software development applications and tools.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred Competencies<br></u></strong><ul><li>Interest in modern security and identity management technologies.</li><li>Exposure to fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of software development.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Problem solving skills.</li><li>Ability to use standard software development applications and tools.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage workload to meet critical project milestones and deadlines.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Attention to detail.<br></li></ul><u><strong>Working Conditions<br></strong></u><ul><li>Ability to work on a flexible schedule, which will include occasional late night and/or weekend hours.</li><li>Position available for hybrid work with in-person meetings attendance required.<br></li></ul><u><strong>Application Documents<br></strong></u><ul><li>Resume/CV (required)</li><li>Cover Letter (preferred)<br></li></ul>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<br><br><strong><u>Job Family<br><br></u></strong>Information Technology<br><br><u><strong>Role Impact<br><br></strong></u>Individual Contributor<br><br><strong><u>FLSA Status<br><br></u></strong>Exempt<br><br><strong><u>Pay Frequency<br><br></u></strong>Monthly<br><br><strong><u>Scheduled</u></strong><strong><u> Weekly Hours<br><br></u></strong>37.5<br><br><strong><u>Benefits Eligible<br><br></u></strong>Yes<br><br><strong><u>Drug Test Required<br><br></u></strong>No<br><br><strong><u>Health Screen Required<br><br></u></strong>No<br><br><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required<br><br></u></strong>No<br><br><strong><u>Posting Statement<br><br></u></strong>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<br><br>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<br><br>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<br><br>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<br><br>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: Solutions Engineer
description: <p>Title:&nbsp;SharePoint Developer / Lead</p><p>Location: Chicago, IL (Initial Remote of 1 month)</p><p>Duration: Fulltime</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Responsibilities:&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Speak the language of business users IT-speak and translate between the two realms</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent coding and unit testing using pre-defined standards / practices in line with expected outcomes desired specific to the project / customer environment.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provide Tier 3 troubleshooting and support for production deployed apps when required.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Define the structure of an application system within the constraints of the requirements, architecture, SDLC and deployment context. Follow the best practices for coding, commenting, and managing code.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Identify feasibility issues while working close with UX experts and provide solutions to the targeted experience goals</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Document the activities and operational procedures</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Work with team members to achieve goals for the project.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lead a team of around 10 – 15 developers.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Team Management, working as a track lead with PM and Scrum Master.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Working closely with onsite team and customer to understand the key expectations on the delivery and ensure the team can meet them.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Qualification:&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BE/ B Tech/ MCA/M Tech</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At least&nbsp;8 – 11 Years of Developer Experience on Power Apps, Power Automate and SharePoint Online / SharePoint 2016 / 2019 or later versions.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Microsoft Certifications:</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SharePoint related certifications and PL-900 would be an added advantage Certification is not mandatory, and TMTPL can provide training for the same.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Key Skills Required:&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong Specialty Insurance domain &amp; IT knowledge</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MS PowerApps / Automate developer to deliver automation capabilities using low/no-code solutions and products.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General understanding of Power Platform business value and product capabilities is required.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hands-on experience with Power Apps and Power Automate</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Design, develop, and support solutions within Power Platform using out-of-the box features and capabilities.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developing Canvas and Model-driven Power Apps.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developing all types of flows using Power Automate.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Support new or existing application development using Microsoft Power Platform technologies.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Implement business solutions with Microsoft Power Platform and SharePoint Online</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development experience in Microsoft 365 technologies including SharePoint Online and the Power Platform (PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI)</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SharePoint/Power Platform related certification</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience on JIRA/ Remedy tool</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Iterative / Agile / DevOps/ ITIL practices &amp; tools</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Data Analysis &amp; Data Migration experience</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Execution of Transformation, Integration &amp; Automation Programs/ Projects</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent verbal, written communication skills and Analytical reasoning ability.&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Troubleshooting abilities</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ability to learn new emerging technologies.</p><p><br></p>

Follow the best practices for coding, commenting, and managing code.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Identify feasibility issues while working close with UX experts and provide solutions to the targeted experience goals</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Document the activities and operational procedures</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Work with team members to achieve goals for the project.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lead a team of around 10 – 15 developers.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Team Management, working as a track lead with PM and Scrum Master.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Working closely with onsite team and customer to understand the key expectations on the delivery and ensure the team can meet them.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Qualification:&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BE/ B Tech/ MCA/M Tech</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At least&nbsp;8 – 11 Years of Developer Experience on Power Apps, Power Automate and SharePoint Online / SharePoint 2016 / 2019 or later versions.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Microsoft Certifications:</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SharePoint related certifications and PL-900 would be an added advantage Certification is not mandatory, and TMTPL can provide training for the same.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>Key Skills Required:&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong Specialty Insurance domain &amp; IT knowledge</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MS PowerApps / Automate developer to deliver automation capabilities using low/no-code solutions and products.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General understanding of Power Platform business value and product capabilities is required.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Hands-on experience with Power Apps and Power Automate</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Design, develop, and support solutions within Power Platform using out-of-the box features and capabilities.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developing Canvas and Model-driven Power Apps.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Developing all types of flows using Power Automate.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Support new or existing application development using Microsoft Power Platform technologies.</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Implement business solutions with Microsoft Power Platform and SharePoint Online</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development experience in Microsoft 365 technologies including SharePoint Online and the Power Platform (PowerApps, Power Automate, Power BI)</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;SharePoint/Power Platform related certification</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience on JIRA/ Remedy tool</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Iterative / Agile / DevOps/ ITIL practices &amp; tools</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Data Analysis &amp; Data Migration experience</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Execution of Transformation, Integration &amp; Automation Programs/ Projects</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent verbal, written communication skills and Analytical reasoning ability.&nbsp;</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Troubleshooting abilities</p><p>•&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ability to learn new emerging technologies.</p><p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer - IAM
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<p><br></p>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<p><br></p>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Services Window: 9*5</li><li>After office hours on call support will be provided for priority tickets. </li><li>Location: Gurgaon office</li><li>Resident Engineer will have minimum 3 years of experience along with relevant security monitoring experience NAC, EDR, WAF, NIPS, Anti-APT, Antivirus etc solution</li><li>He should have knowledge on monitoring tool i.e SolarWinds etc. </li><li>He should have knowledge on VMC vulnerability management</li><li>He should have knowledge on compliance management. </li><li>He should have any basic security certification i.e CompTIA+ security, CCNA Security etc</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>1.2 Scope for onsite Resource:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide business hours support within defined SBI Card SLA of incident/change/problem management. </li><li>Provide L1 support for IT security incidents and incidents related to security components. </li><li>Track and monitor incidents surfaced from internal &amp; external attacks. Also, coordinate between the teams for root cause analysis and corrective actions</li><li>Anti-virus – Virus Incident review and end to end tracking &amp; ensure necessary remediation via the IT &amp; DC Support team. </li><li>Responsible to look after security alerts/Event for respective installed SecOps tools. </li><li>Responsible to participate in incident event and to prepare respective response. </li><li>Co-ordination with different team/stakeholder to close any incident, event, or changes. </li><li>He would have knowledge on ITIL process. </li><li>He would prepare and provide compliance /KPI etc related documents. </li><li>Work in 24*7 shift as per defined roster</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Sharepoint Developer
description: <ul><li>Technical solid knowledge of Optim and GenRocket</li><li>Competent understanding of Test Data Management related to data security, data masking, synthetic data creation and test data strategy planning.</li><li>Experience on DB migration/consolidation projects</li><li>Exceptional analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.</li><li>Excellent spoken and written communication to explain the methods to a technical and non-technical audience.</li><li>The ability to think laterally and 'outside the box.'</li><li>Teamwork skills, to support colleagues and share techniques.</li><li>Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and the persistence to apply different techniques to get the job done.</li><li>Competent in TDM functions like data masking, data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, data mining, data handling, data management and synthetic data creation, APIs, Macros</li><li>Collaborates with subject matter experts and data stewards to identify PII definitions, data strategies, policies, controls, and programs to ensure enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.</li><li>Reviewing data needs and driving data solutioning decisions. Ability to build data masking configurations in the data masking tools. Provide mentoring to Test Data Analysts as needed.</li></ul> Please Share Resumes to<strong> vmarella@esharpedge.com</strong>

title: Software Engineer (REM002C)
description: <strong><u>Department</u></strong><p><br></p>Provost Globus Software Engineering 1<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>Globus (www.globus.org) is a sustainable, non-profit business within The University of Chicago delivering solutions to the research community worldwide. Globus develops and provides critical services that support scientific research for governmental, academic, and commercial organizations in a wide range of disciplines including life sciences, physics, and astronomy. We develop, operate, and sell commercial-quality, cloud-based software application and platform services used by 10s of thousands of researchers to manage their large–and growing–data management challenges. We have offices located at 401 North Michigan Avenue in the heart of downtown Chicago and remote employees who work-from-home. Globus, together with Globus Labs, a research group within the University of Chicago, and part of the Data Science and Learning Division at Argonne National Labs, develop and deploy cutting edge technologies to solve new challenges facing the scientific community and enable break-through scientific discoveries.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Reporting to the Software Development Manager, the focus of this position is to architect and build identity and access management systems for Globus Software as a Service (SaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) products. As a member of the product team, your work will support researchers worldwide by delivering key security solutions that underpin the Globus research data management services, and a platform that secures applications and clients across a diverse research ecosystem.<p><br></p>We're looking for skilled Python engineers to create, operate, and integrate identity management services through the use of modern technologies and techniques from Web and Cloud computing. This role is perfect if you are interested in tackling the challenges of improving online security and privacy management while simplifying usability. If you enjoy collaborative, innovative, mission-driven environments, Globus could be a great fit for you!<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Architecture and Design: Participate in the definition and documentation of requirements, architecture and design of security and authentication infrastructure, based on knowledge of relevant software technologies and standards being developed and used in commercial and scientific communities.</li><li>Software Development: Develop, test, document, deploy and maintain high-quality software, including REST interfaces, command-line interfaces, email and messaging services, and identity provider integrations. </li><li>Support and Documentation: Work in close collaboration with the Globus front line support and professional services teams, and directly with end users, to provide technical support services. Document standard operating procedures and protocols.</li><li>Team Coordination and Professional Development: Contribute to team coordination and development activities, including project planning, project reporting, and recruitment. Stay abreast of current security best practices and help evangelize security standards within the organization.</li><li>Investigates, analyzes and resolves day-to-day technical problems using standard procedures. </li><li>Works with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for developmental programs. Receives a moderate level of guidance to design applications to meet University and business requirements. </li><li>Performs other related work as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong></u><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Work Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 2-5 years of work experience in a related job discipline.<p><br></p><li></li><p><br></p><strong><u>Certifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of relevant programming experience developing, implementing, and debugging Python for personal or professional projects.</li><li>Experience with SQL, Databases, and web technologies.</li><li>2+ years of experience with web SSO and authentication protocols like OAuth2 and SAML.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills Or Knowledge</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Python web framework (e.g. Flask/Django).</li><li>SQL databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite).</li><li>Implementing REST API’s.</li><li>Web technologies (e.g. Javascript, HTML, CSS).</li><li>Unit testing and continuous integration tools (e.g. pytest, Jenkins).</li><li>Contributing to an open source project.</li><li>Background with containers (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, Singularity).</li><li>Shell scripting (e.g., Bash).</li><li>Agile (e.g. Scrum) development processes.</li><li>Use standard software development applications and tools.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Competencies</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interest in modern security and identity management technologies.</li><li>Exposure to fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of software development.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Problem solving skills.</li><li>Ability to use standard software development applications and tools.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage workload to meet critical project milestones and deadlines.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Attention to detail.</li><li>Confidentiality related to sensitive University matters such as, strategic initiatives, trade secrets, quiet periods, and scientific discoveries yet to be put in the public domain.</li><li>Ability to work on a flexible schedule, which will include occasional late night and/or weekend hours.</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>Working Conditions</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>This job requires occasional evening or weekend hours.</li><li>Position available for hybrid work with in-person meetings attendance required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Resume (required)</li></ul><p><br></p>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Family</u></strong><p><br></p>Information Technology<p><br></p><u><strong>Role Impact</strong></u><p><br></p>Individual Contributor<p><br></p><strong><u>FLSA Status</u></strong><p><br></p>Exempt<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Frequency</u></strong><p><br></p>Monthly<p><br></p><strong><u>Scheduled</u></strong><strong><u> Weekly Hours</u></strong><p><br></p>37.5<p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits Eligible</u></strong><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong><u>Drug Test Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Health Screen Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Posting Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<p><br></p>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<p><br></p>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<p><br></p>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

standard software development applications and tools.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Competencies</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interest in modern security and identity management technologies.</li><li>Exposure to fundamental concepts, practices, and procedures of software development.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Problem solving skills.</li><li>Ability to use standard software development applications and tools.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage workload to meet critical project milestones and deadlines.</li><li>Ability to work in a collaborative team environment.</li><li>Attention to detail.</li><li>Confidentiality related to sensitive University matters such as, strategic initiatives, trade secrets, quiet periods, and scientific discoveries yet to be put in the public domain.</li><li>Ability to work on a flexible schedule, which will include occasional late night and/or weekend hours.</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>Working Conditions</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>This job requires occasional evening or weekend hours.</li><li>Position available for hybrid work with in-person title: Software Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Responsible for coordinating data needs across all value streams and provide insight and support into data enhancements and data improvements as identified by gap analyses. The roles will require thought leadership and, at time, solution architecture skills, as well as various technical experience including data generation, data scrubbing, data provisioning, data obfuscation, and solutioning and designing of data architecture and engineering enhancements in distributed environments.<br><br><strong><u>Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Technical solid knowledge of Optim and GenRocket</li><li>Competent understanding of Test Data Management related to data security, data masking, synthetic data creation and test data strategy planning.</li><li>Experience on DB migration/consolidation projects</li><li>Exceptional analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.</li><li>Excellent spoken and written communication to explain the methods to a technical and non-technical audience.</li><li>The ability to think laterally and 'outside the box.'</li><li>Teamwork skills, to support colleagues and share techniques.</li><li>Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and the persistence to apply different techniques to get the job done.</li><li>Competent in TDM functions like data masking, data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, data mining, data handling, data management and synthetic data creation, APIs, Macros</li><li>Collaborates with subject matter experts and data stewards to identify PII definitions, data strategies, policies, controls, and programs to ensure enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.</li><li>Reviewing data needs and driving data solutioning decisions. Ability to build data masking configurations in the data masking tools. Provide mentoring to Test Data Analysts as needed.</li></ul>

title: VBA & Full Stack Developer, Riverwoods IL
description: <strong>Together, we can beat cancer.</strong><p><br></p>At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.<p><br></p>We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.<p><br></p>If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.<p><br></p>To provide operational, technical support, maintenance, and customer service to the delivery of Proton Therapy<p><br></p>Provides highly visible customer support through the performance of on-site installation of proton therapy equipment and ancillary devices, as well as overseeing any necessary diagnoses, troubleshooting, service, and repair of complex equipment and systems. Checks out and approves operational quality of system equipment. Instructs customers in the operation and maintenance of the system. Serves as company liaison with customer on administrative and technical matters for assigned projects. Interprets customers’ needs and clarifies if the responsibility for problem resolution falls to sales personnel, customer support reps, or engineers. This job may include any aspect of field support, and is not limited to system hardware and software, PCs, and networking/wireless networking. Installs and upgrades a wide range of company products according to technical documentation and company guidelines to ensure that customer’s equipment operates efficiently. Demonstrates to customer equipment operation and specification according to Customer Acceptance Procedure (CAP). Instructs customers in operation and basic maintenance of VMS products. Works in small teams, and requires a minimum of supervision. Applicable to the Oncology Systems business only: Position must have full access to VMS client sites to perform the essential functions of this position. Many VMS clients require VMS employees and representatives to meet certain “Vendor Credentialing” requirements before they will be allowed to have access to their sites. Unless prohibited by law, position must meet all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to have full client access, and must continue to meet those requirements during the course of VMS employment in this position. May be required to specialize in specific technical areas and have some level of cross-functional and overall system knowledge. Work at customer sites long term (up to 2+ years) depending on the project needs and scope. Conduct the Acceptance Conditions testing, to ensure that all installation conditions will be met according to schedule and that customers can sign the Acceptance Letters. Input detailed records of installation and upgrade work performed into company information systems to ensure accurate updated customer installation information is available to other VMS functions. Maintain a high degree of professional knowledge and safety consciousness according to VMS guidelines in order to perform activities under the safest working conditions. Performs parts inventory and ordering for assigned installation, including replenishing spare parts kit, short shipment and return consigned parts appropriately and in a timely manner per procedure as necessary for each install. Maintain technical documentation regarding operating characteristics, design factors, technical performance and development of products to improve installation efficiency. Report by means of FSR’s, time sheets, expense reports, etc. regularly to ensure accurate company statistical data on customer-oriented activities is available. Advise less experienced Installation Representatives in technical matters.<p><br></p>Minimum Required Skills and Knowledge: Knowledge of and sound professional experience with electronic and electro-mechanical engineering, testing equipment used for verification, checkout and calibration of electronic and/or mechanical equipment. Knowledge of and professional technical experience with micro-computers/PC based systems Customer focused attitude Articulate and skilled in interpersonal communication Fluency in English, both written and spoken Other Desired Skills and Knowledge: Sound computer usage and debugging skills Sound knowledge of networks and networking techniques Sound understanding of imaging systems Fluency in German, both written and spoken Required Certifications and Training: Obtains and completes LMS training plan specific to assigned responsibility. Applicable to the Oncology Systems business only: Meets all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to gain VMS client site access, unless prohibited by law. These requirements vary by client and may include, but are not limited to: Proof of valid identification (photo, driver’s license, SSN) Criminal background checks Drug screens Immunizations (Hep B, MMR, Varicella, Influenza, Tetanus) Annual TB testing Healthcare trainings Experience Level with Business Tools: Familiar with business tools such as: E-mail, Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Experience with HCM (e.g., Workday) or equivalent ERP product and productivity software desired. High School Degree or equivalent 2 – 3 years of related experience<p><br></p>Position must have full access to Varian client sites to perform the essential functions of this position. Many clients require Varian employees and representatives to meet certain Vendor Credentialing requirements before they will be allowed to have access to their sites. Unless prohibited by law, position must meet all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to have full client access and must continue to meet those requirements during the course of employment in this position. These requirements vary by client and may include, but are not limited to: Proof of valid identification (photo, driver's license, SSN) Criminal background checks Drug screens Immunizations (COVID-19, Hep B, MMR, Varicella, Influenza, Tetanus) Annual TB testing Healthcare training<p><br></p><strong>Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.</strong><p><br></p>We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.<p><br></p><strong>#TogetherWeFight</strong><p><br></p>Privacy Statement<p><br></p>The base pay range for this position is<p><br></p>Min $59,400 - Max $101,000<p><br></p>The pay wage range shown is based on the job posting's primary location. Actual compensation packages are based on a wide array of factors, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications, and location.

title: Field Service Engineer
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a Pen-Testing Vulnerabilities Security Engineer. Security Red Team testers engage in targeted simulations consisting of threat intelligence gathering, network &amp; application penetration testing, social engineering, physical security testing, mobile device testing, and more. Team members must ensure the availability and integrity of operational systems and self-disclose identified findings in a timely/proactive manner.<p><br></p>Candidate will have extensive experience in more than one of the following security testing domains: Open Source Intelligence, Network/Application, Web Application, Mobile Application, and Social Engineering. Experience testing database Servers as well as proficiency with custom Scripting and automation is a huge plus.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Execute Red Team simulations based on organizationally defined threat scenarios with strict adherence to the agreed-upon rules of engagement.</li><li>Conduct various Red Team activities such as: Intelligence Gathering, Network/Operating System/Application Penetration Testing, Web Application Penetration Testing, Mobile Application Testing, Social Engineering, Basic Emissions/Signals Testing, Physical Security Testing, etc.</li><li>Execute Open Source Intelligence Collection and Analysis Techniques (OSINT); leverage available resources and develop custom tools.</li><li>Understand vulnerabilities and develop relevant exploits/payloads for use during Red Team activities.</li><li>Perform security risk assessment, threat analysis and threat modelling.</li><li>Perform independent reviews of security, network, and applications.</li><li>Plan/Design/Execute security related activities and create artifacts.</li><li>Stay on-time, on-budget, and within scope of testing activities.</li><li>Develop clear detailed reports and recommendations based on concrete evidence.</li><li>Debrief users and provide remediation strategy on findings.</li><li>Ensure alignment of security controls in testing program and supporting services and related policies and procedures with applicable regulations and industry standard best practices.</li><li>Assist management with the improvement of policies and procedures to support Security Testing and Red Team activities as well as other security duties which may arise.</li><li>Participate in developing a security roadmap, adopt security best practices, and implement new ideas and innovations according to the industry trends.</li><li>Adhere to the best practices and work for delivering secured and quality products.</li><li>Consult with technical experts and system owners on all aspects of Information Security and Compliance.</li><li>Work closely with Production Support staff, Incidence Response, and IT infrastructure to increase organizational security posture.</li><li>Support security objectives and remediation efforts relating to Security Testing.</li><li>Supports and successfully completes Audits.</li><li>Cross-train the other Security Red Team members.</li><li>Cross-train other teams within Security Services and IT departments to provide subject matter knowledge of a specific adversarial threat/risk, or to assist with remediation path recommendations</li><li>Participate in Lessons Learned process to provide information to help improve practices, methodologies, tools, and other technologies.</li><li>Participate on various technical committees and provide input and feedback to department.</li><li>Stay current on emerging technology trends and the threat landscape.</li><li>Advise IT on current and emerging threats, their attack vectors, and how to mitigate them.</li><li>Provide leadership, share knowledge and mentor team members.</li><li>Train Full time and contingent Security Testing Red Team personnel.</li><li>Support Security Red Team management and activities and be a team player.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent focused domain areas of expertise as well as a good breadth of experience across Network/Application Penetration Testing, Web Application Penetration Testing, Mobile Application Penetration Testing, Social Engineering and Open Source Intelligence, Basic Emissions Testing, Physical Security Testing, and more.</li><li>Proven due diligence and research ability via open source avenues and technology.</li><li>Strong familiarity with enterprise technologies; strong technical background and understanding of security-related technologies; prefer operational experience as an administrator, engineer, or developer and direct experience testing in commercial cloud environments (AWS, Azure, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS).</li><li>Good applicable knowledge of policy and procedure development, systems analysis, Information Assurance (IA) policy, vulnerability management, and risk management</li><li>Good understanding of regulatory standards including CSF, NIST, PCI, SSAE 16, SAS 70, HIPPA, FIPS 199, COBIT 5 and others as needed.</li><li>Strong knowledge of cryptography (symmetric, asymmetric, hashing) and its various applications.</li><li>Strong knowledge of common enterprise infrastructure technology stacks and network configurations.</li><li>Exhibit ability to understand and probe/exploit a diverse range of Network and Internet Protocols.</li><li>Exhibit ability to understand and modify code in a diverse range of programming languages and frameworks; must have direct practical experience with one or more high level programming language.</li><li>Strong proficiency in network, application, emissions and physical security.</li><li>Strong proficiency in social engineering and intelligence gathering.</li><li>Strong experience with custom Scripting (python, powershell, bash, etc.) and process automation.</li><li>Strong experience with database security testing (MSSQL, DB2, MySQL, etc.).</li><li>Strong proficiency with common penetration testing tools (Kali, Armitage, Metasploit, Cobalt Strike, Nmap, Qualys, Nessus, Burp Suite, Wireshark, Recon-NG, Netsparker, Ettercap/Bettercap, Hashcat, Bloodhound, Ida Pro, Ghidra, Sublist3r, Rubeus, Mimikatz, CrackMapExec, Exploitdb, Yersinia, Impacket, etc.).</li><li>Experience with Mainframes, Windows, Unix, MacOS, Cisco, platforms and controls.</li><li>Proficient in creating content with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).</li><li>Proficient in basic document management in a Microsoft SharePoint environment.</li><li>Experience with dedicated document management tools (eg, DMS, PolicyTech) a plus.</li><li>Experience with using ServiceNow a plus.</li><li>BS in Computer Science, Information Management, Information Security or other comparable technical degree from an accredited college/university desired.</li><li>3+ Years' experience penetration testing.</li><li>5+ Years' experience in Information Assurance or Information Security environment.</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Security-related certifications (CISSP, CISA, CRISK, ISSAP, GSLC, OSCP, OSCE, GPEN, or GXPN, etc.) highly desired.</li></ul>

improvement of policies and procedures to support Security Testing and Red Team activities as well as other security duties which may arise.</li><li>Participate in developing a security roadmap, adopt security best practices, and implement new ideas and innovations according to the industry trends.</li><li>Adhere to the best practices and work for delivering secured and quality products.</li><li>Consult with technical experts and system owners on all aspects of Information Security and Compliance.</li><li>Work closely with Production Support staff, Incidence Response, and IT infrastructure to increase organizational security posture.</li><li>Support security objectives and remediation efforts relating to Security Testing.</li><li>Supports and successfully completes Audits.</li><li>Cross-train the other Security Red Team members.</li><li>Cross-train other teams within Security Services and IT departments to provide subject matter knowledge of a specific adversarial threat/risk, or to assist with remediation path recommendations</li><li>Participate in Lessons Learned process to provide information to help improve practices, methodologies, tools, and other technologies.</li><li>Participate on various technical committees and provide input and feedback to department.</li><li>Stay current on emerging technology trends and the threat landscape.</li><li>Advise IT on current and emerging threats, their attack vectors, and how to mitigate them.</li><li>Provide leadership, share knowledge and mentor team members.</li><li>Train Full time and contingent Security Testing Red Team personnel.</li><li>Support Security Red Team management and activities and be a team player.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent focused domain areas of expertise as well as a good breadth of experience across Network/Application Penetration Testing, Web Application Penetration Testing, Mobile Application Penetration Testing, Social Engineering and Open Source Intelligence, Basic Emissions Testing, Physical Security Testing, and more.</li><li>Proven due diligence and research ability via open source avenues and technology.</li><li>Strong familiarity with enterprise technologies; strong technical background and understanding of security-related technologies; prefer operational experience as an administrator, engineer, or developer and direct experience testing in commercial cloud environments (AWS, Azure, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS).</li><li>Good applicable knowledge of policy and procedure development, systems analysis, Information Assurance (IA) policy, vulnerability management, and risk management</li><li>Good understanding of regulatory standards including CSF, NIST, PCI, SSAE 16, SAS 70, HIPPA, FIPS 199, COBIT 5 and others as needed.</li><li>Strong knowledge of cryptography (symmetric, asymmetric, hashing) and its various applications.</li><li>Strong knowledge of common enterprise infrastructure technology stacks and network configurations.</li><li>Exhibit ability to understand and probe/exploit a diverse range of Network and Internet Protocols.</li><li>Exhibit ability to understand and modify code in a diverse range of programming languages and frameworks; must have direct practical experience with one or more high level programming language.</li><li>Strong proficiency in network, application, emissions and physical security.</li><li>Strong proficiency in social engineering and intelligence gathering.</li><li>Strong experience with custom Scripting (python, powershell, bash, etc.) and process automation.</li><li>Strong experience with database security testing (MSSQL, DB2, MySQL, etc.).</li><li>Strong proficiency with common penetration testing tools (Kali, Armitage, Metasploit, Cobalt Strike, Nmap, Qualys, Nessus, Burp Suite, Wireshark, Recon-NG, Netsparker, Ettercap/Bettercap, Hashcat, Bloodhound, Ida Pro, Ghidra, Sublist3r, Rubeus, Mimikatz, CrackMapExec, Exploitdb, Yersinia, Impacket, etc.).</li><li>Experience with Mainframes, Windows, Unix, MacOS, Cisco, platforms and controls.</li><li>Proficient in creating content with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio).</li><li>Proficient in basic document management in a Microsoft SharePoint environment.</li><li>Experience with dedicated document management tools (eg, DMS, PolicyTech) a plus.</li><li>Experience with using ServiceNow a plus.</li><li>BS in Computer Science, Information Management, Information Security or other comparable technical degree from an accredited college/university desired.</li><li>3+ Years' experience penetration testing.</li><li>5+ Years' experience in Information Assurance or Information Security environment.</li><li>Certificates or Licenses:</li><li>Security-related certifications (CISSP, CISA, CRISK, ISSAP, GSLC, OSCP, OSCE, GPEN, or GXPN, etc.) highly desired.</li></ul>

title: Benefits Analyst
description: <strong>6+ Months Contract<br><br>Test Data Management Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Rate: $55/60/Hour<br><br>Visa: No H1B/No CPT/No TN<br><br></strong><strong>Location: Riverwoods, Illinois (Onsite)<br><br></strong><strong>Client Domain: Health insurance<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Responsible for coordinating data needs across all value streams and providing insight and support into data enhancements and improvements identified by gap analyses. The roles will require thought leadership and, at times, solution architecture skills, as well as various technical experiences including data generation, data scrubbing, data provisioning, data obfuscation, and solutions and designing of data architecture and engineering enhancements in distributed environments<br><br><strong><u>Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Technical solid knowledge of Optim and GenRocket</li><li>Competent understanding of Test Data Management related to data security, data masking, synthetic data creation and test data strategy planning.</li><li>Experience on DB migration/consolidation projects</li><li>Exceptional analytic and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.</li><li>Excellent spoken and written communication to explain the methods to a technical and non-technical audience.</li><li>The ability to think laterally and 'outside the box.'</li><li>Teamwork skills, to support colleagues and share techniques.</li><li>Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and the persistence to apply different techniques to get the job done.</li><li>Competent in TDM functions like data masking, data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, data mining, data handling, data management and synthetic data creation, APIs, Macros</li><li>Collaborates with subject matter experts and data stewards to identify PII definitions, data strategies, policies, controls, and programs to ensure enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.</li><li>Reviewing data needs and driving data solutioning decisions. Ability to build data masking configurations in the data masking tools. Provide mentoring to Test Data Analysts as needed.</li></ul>

title: Software Quality Assurance Tester
description: We're on the lookout for an enthusiastic and talented IT Web/Mobile Application Developer to join our dynamic team! If you're passionate about crafting innovative web and mobile applications, this is the perfect opportunity for you. As our developer, you'll have the chance to collaborate across various business functions, creating high-performing applications that are both scalable and user-friendly. Get ready to showcase your technical expertise as you tackle challenges, troubleshoot issues, and make a real impact by saving the day for our users!<br><br>At our company, we embrace the New Ways of Work, allowing you to work remotely from anywhere in the United States (except Hawaii or United States Territories). With this flexibility, you'll enjoy a perfect work-life balance. While most of your work will be remote, occasional travel of up to 20% may be required, including a week-long stay in Rosemont, IL, each month (Monday morning to Friday afternoon). Additionally, you may need to make infrequent visits to divisions and attend vendor seminars.<br><br>What we're looking for in our ideal Web/Mobile Application Developer:<br><br>Proficiency in Angular, React, Rest API, Node, and AWS is a must. Show us what you've got!<br><br><strong><u>Your Responsibilities Will Include<br><br></u></strong>Actively participating in project ideation, from concept to delivery<br><br>Gathering information from existing systems and analyzing program and time requirements<br><br>Creating detailed specifications for program development and coding<br><br>Developing moderately complex programs that meet technical standards and specifications<br><br>Designing and implementing effective test plans to verify program logic<br><br>Documenting your work assignments, including program code and technical documentation<br><br>Assisting support and project personnel in resolving program-related issues<br><br><strong><u>To Qualify For This Role, You Should Have<br><br></u></strong>A B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field (required)<br><br><strong><u>Experience In Requirements Gathering, Design, Implementation, Integration, And Testing<br><br></u></strong>Coursework or demonstrated skill in object-oriented programming<br><br>Previous experience in web application development or hands-on website development<br><br>The ability to seamlessly integrate front-end templates with back-end functionality<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br><br>Strong organizational and multitasking abilities<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Skills<br><br></u></strong>Knowledge of microservice architecture<br><br>Proficiency in JDBC, JMS, Web Services, J2EE, Applet, Servlet, JSP, JSON<br><br>Experience with HTML5, CSS3, Angular, JavaScript/jQuery<br><br>Familiarity with WebLogic, Tomcat<br><br>Exposure to Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, and Swagger<br><br>Experience with AWS services such as API Gateway, WebSocket, Lambda, EC2, S3<br><br>Familiarity with New Relic and Git<br><br>We strive to provide competitive compensation based on experience, geographic location, and other factors permitted by law, in accordance with state and local regulations.<br><br>Join our team and be part of an exciting journey in the world of web and mobile application development! Apply today and let your skills shine in our collaborative and innovative environment.<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 64,000.00 86,000.00 Per Year

description: ProSource is accepting applications for the following position on behalf of our client. If you are interested and feel you meet the qualifications, we would love to hear from you.<p><br></p><strong>Position: </strong>Software Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>Remote<p><br></p><strong>Type: </strong>Direct Hire, Full-Time<p><br></p><strong>Comp: </strong>$80,000 - $110,000<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with product managers, designers, and stakeholders to understand software requirements and translate them into technical specifications.</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain software applications, ensuring adherence to coding standards, best practices, and scalability requirements.</li><li>Write efficient, robust, and reusable code in one or more programming languages (e.g., Java, C++, Python, JavaScript).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong programming skills and proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., Java, C++, Python, JavaScript).</li><li>Solid understanding of software development principles, algorithms, and data structures.</li><li>Experience with software development methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.</li><li>Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development tools.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About ProSource</u></strong><p><br></p>ProSource is a full-service staffing company that conducts nationwide searches on behalf of our clients offering direct hire, contract and contract-to-hire services. We take your privacy seriously and will not share your personal information with any organization without your prior approval.<p><br></p>Feel free to contact us directly at jobs@askprosource.com or visit www.askprosource.com for additional job opportunities. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Test Data Management Engineer
description: <strong>Innovate here. And see your ideas come to life.<br><br></strong>It's an exciting time to work in tech at Edward Jones. We are making massive investments in emerging technologies to improve how we work with our clients and with each other. Relationships are the focus of our business model. And working in Technology here means using your skills to build, deliver and maintain the technologies that enable us to deepen and support those relationships. The best part? We develop and create our own industry-leading solutions internally. And you can be a part of it. Working with emerging new technologies. Creating platforms, programs and experiences that change how we work together - and support our client-first focus. Changing the future of our firm, the industry and the advisor-client relationship.<br><br><strong><u>Job Overview<br><br></u></strong>Position Schedule: Full-Time<br><br>In 2022, Edward Jones invested $1 billion in technology infrastructure, digital initiatives, and virtual business enablement tools. We're currently in the test and learn phase and are looking for talented, motivated professionals, that want to be part of this transformational journey. Cloud-based architecture and modern technical capabilities will enable us to grow our impact while providing the best client experience possible<br><br>You may be surprised to know that Edward Jones employs thousands of technical resources - all focused on creating world-class experiences for our clients and branch offices. If you've considered Edward Jones in the past, it's time to take another look. We are in the midst of embracing a modern, cloud-based architecture and are looking for exceptional individuals that want to be a part of that future.<br><br>We've invested millions of dollars into new technology platforms to help improve what matters most in our industry, client experience. We're currently implementing a modern, cloud based architecture and are looking for talented, and motived professionals that want to be part of providing the best client experience and financial resources possible.<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br><br></u></strong>As a Platform Engineer, you will be a part of a diverse and collaborative team whose end goal is to focus on the firm's Enterprise Architecture in order to enable rapid system integrations with a steady focus on automation of processes. Together, we will focus on the collaboration with a diverse array of stakeholders from each area of the Technology division for continuous improvement.<br><br><strong><u>You Could Work On Any Of The Following Areas<br><br></u></strong>We are hoping that you will want to be apart an exception challenge and opportunity for someone who is equally as excited as we are for rapid change and continuous learning.<br><ul><li>Work closely with all members within Enterprise Architecture to ensure all systems and integrations are maintained with proper documentation. </li><li>Serve as a subject matter expert while leading all integrations with the Enterprise Architecture tool.</li><li>Collaborate with Architects and Leaders within Technology to provide guidance and leadership on data management best practices within the tool.</li><li>Document processes and procedures for internal and end-user consumption.</li><li>Exemplify excellent communication and interpersonal skills to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.</li><li>Perform root cause analysis to be able to evaluate how systems fit together and how data flows from one system to another.</li><li>Spearhead and drive innovation through the exploration and implementation of new technologies and methodologies. </li><li>Serve as an informal leader with exceptional project management skills to drive cross functional teams to meet goals while maintaining governance standards. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills<br><br></u></strong>The salary range for this role is based on national data and actual pay is based on skills, experience, education, and other relevant factors for a potential new associate<br><br>At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing.<br><br>Hiring Minimum: $92984<br><br>Hiring Maximum: $158325<br><br><strong><u>Skills/Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>What You'll Need:<br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of experience in IT operations, enterprise architecture, and/or related field.</li><li>5+ years of experience developing/customizing and monitoring tools and utilities. </li><li>Hands on experience building and integrating APIs. </li><li>Experience implementing and administering/managing technical solutions in major, large-scale system implementations. <br></li></ul><strong><u>What Could Set You Apart<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with Python, GitHub, Azure, and development skills</li><li>Experience with LeanIX or other EA tools<br></li></ul><strong>Awards &amp; Accolades</strong><ul><li>100 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2022, published Fortune July 2022, Great Places to Work® data as of March 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones was recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Millennials by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. The privately held firm ranked No. 2 overall, in its fourth appearance on the list.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, published September 2022, research by Great Places to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>Edward Jones has been named to the 2022 Best Workplaces for Women list by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine, ranking No. 45.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For, published April 2022, research by Great Place to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>For the 23rd time, Edward Jones has earned a spot on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® ranking by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. Edward Jones ranked No. 35 on the prestigious 2022 list.</li><li>2022 Best Places to Work For LGBTQ+ Equality, Great Place to Work® in partnership with Human Rights Campaign Foundation, published Equity Magazine January 2022, data as of July 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.<br></li></ul></ul></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.<br><br>In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.<br><br>Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.<br><br>Demi Brandt<br><br>

Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.<br></li></ul></ul></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.<br><br>In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.<br><br>Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.<br><br>Demi Brandt<br><br>

title: IT Web / Mobile Application Develope - Remote | WFH
description: <strong>What We're Building And Why We're Building It.</strong><p><br></p>There's a reason Fetch is ranked top 10 in Shopping in the App Store. Every day, millions of people earn Fetch Points buying brands they love. From the grocery aisle to the drive-through, Fetch makes saving money fun. We're more than just a build-first tech unicorn. We're a revolutionary shopping platform where brands and consumers come together for a loyalty-driving, points-exploding, money-saving party.<p><br></p>Join a fast-growing, founder-led technology company that's still only in its early innings. Ranked one of America's Best Startup Employers by Forbes two years in a row, Fetch is building a people-first culture rooted in trust and accountability. How do we do it? By empowering employees to think big, challenge ideas, and find new ways to bring the fun to Fetch. So what are you waiting for? Apply to join our rocketship today!<p><br></p><em>Fetch is an equal employment opportunity employer.</em><p><br></p><strong>The Role:</strong><p><br></p>Fetch's next step in evolving the shopping experience will require a <strong>Site Reliability Engineer</strong>.<p><br></p>The Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team combines software and systems engineering to build and run distributed, fault-tolerant systems at scale. SREs ensure that Fetch's services — both our externally visible and internally critical systems — have reliability and uptime appropriate to our users' needs. In addition, we keep an ever watchful eye on system capacity and performance. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers, and much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure, and eliminating work through automation.<p><br></p>Fetch's culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving, and openness is key to our success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big, and take risks in a blame-free environment. We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services - from inception and design, through deployment, operation, and refinement. </li><li>Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning, and readiness reviews. </li><li>Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency, and overall system health. </li><li>Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity. </li><li>Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems by participating in the on-call rotation. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with one or more high-level programming languages (e.g. Java, Python, Go, C/C++). </li><li>Experience with Unix/Linux operating system internals, networking, or cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP). </li><li>Experience with analyzing and troubleshooting systems. </li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting distributed systems. </li><li>Experience designing and developing software oriented towards systems or infrastructure automation. </li><li>Ability to debug/optimize code and automate routine tasks. </li><li>Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>At Fetch, we'll give you the tools to feel healthy, happy and secure through:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Stock Options for everyone</li><li>401k Match: Dollar-for-dollar match up to 4%. </li><li>Benefits for humans and pets: We offer comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans for everyone including your pets. </li><li>Continuing Education: Fetch provides Ten Thousand per year in education reimbursement. </li><li>Employee Resource Groups: Take part in employee-led groups that are centered around fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace through events, dialogue and advocacy. The ERGs participate in our Inclusion Council with members of executive leadership. </li><li>Paid Time Off: On top of our flexible PTO, Fetch observes 9 paid holidays, including Juneteenth and Indigenous People's Day, as well as our year-end week-long break. </li><li>Robust Leave Policies: 18 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 12 weeks for secondary caregivers, and a flexible return to work schedule. </li><li>Hybrid Work Environment: Collaborate with your team in one of our stunning offices in Madison, Birmingham, or Chicago. We'll ensure you are equally equipped with the hardware and software you need to get your job done in the comfort of your home.</li></ul>
