title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: We are building a team of trailblazers, who embody growth, impact, and excellence.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>As a Reliability Data Analyst II, you will execute intermediate to advance level task work for engineering projects across multiple areas of reliability data gathering, organizing, analyzing, and strategizing.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solve complex reliability problems using professional judgment to ensure tasks include the appropriate level of assessment, analysis, and evaluation while following best practices and RAGAGEP</li><li>With minimal procedural guidance, analyze the overall risk levels for fixed and non-fixed assets to create reliability strategies</li><li>Organize and analyze pertinent data to evaluate the consequence and probability of failures in fixed and non-fixed assets across multiple sites and units</li><li>Gather and organize operations and maintenance data to make recommendations in reliability strategies</li><li>Facilitate customer validations meetings in process interviews, task selections, and other reliability focused areas of scope</li><li>Leverage internal and external software to deliver analysis and strategies for large industrial complex facilities</li><li>Extract and verify pertinent reliability information from multiple data sources using different technologies</li><li>Organize large industrial complex facilities into smaller and more manageable sections based on industry standards or customer guidance</li><li>Gather asset counts and documentation related to project scopes of work</li><li>Analyze effectiveness of historical non-destructive examination methods using various methodologies</li><li>Use verbal and written communication skills to work with our customers</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Accountabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Meet and maintain excellent quality and efficiency for all deliverables</li><li>Execute strategies to deliver reliability services to our customers</li><li>Demonstrate effective time management skills to ensure timely completion of assigned tasks</li><li>Maintain professional relationships and effectively communicate with team members</li><li>Participate in endeavors that provide professional development and technical/soft skill training</li><li>Recognize inefficiencies and facilitate innovation that results in significant improvements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in an engineering field or 3+ years working in the reliability data industry</li><li>Independent problem solver and high performing team player</li><li>Able to adapt to evolving client demands and dynamic work environment</li><li>Ability to understand technical literature (e.g. process descriptions, training manuals)</li><li>Ability to develop technical documents. (Technical Writing Skills)</li><li>Ability to understand Piping and Instrument Diagrams, Logic Diagrams, Cause and Effect Diagrams, and Electrical One-Line Diagrams</li><li>Effective and professional verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Detail-oriented with a strong aptitude for learning new processes and skills</li><li>Initiative to exceed beyond set expectations</li><li>Willingness to travel up to 50% of the time</li><li>Commitment to relocate domestically or internationally (multiple locations)</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li>1+ years of professional working experience in the petroleum, chemical, mining process, or wastewater industries</li><li>Any of the following API Certifications:</li><ul><li>510</li><li>570</li><li>580</li><li>653</li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Equipment and Software Knowledge </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Microsoft Office Suite – intermediate to advanced level proficiently</li><li>Integrated Database Management Systems (PCMS, Meridium, etc.)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Direct Reports </strong><p><br></p>There will be no direct reports to this role.<p><br></p><strong>Working Environment </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Conditions may include working inside and/or outside. May work around office machinery with moving parts and moving objects. Working near radiant and electrical energy. Working closely with others or working alone. Working extended or irregular hours and travelling by all possible modes of transportation.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to sit for extended periods of time, repeated motions of the hands, wrists and fingers, identify colors, hear with aid, see, write, count, read, speak, communicate with other to exchange information, analyze, lift and carry under 30 lbs., and perceive depth.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Tools And PPE Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Equipment (machines, tools, devices) used in performing the essential job function include but not limited to computers and related equipment, calculators, copiers, fax machines, and telephone. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Limitations and Disclaimer </strong><p><br></p>This job description describes the general job duties, accountabilities and physical requirements associates with the position; <strong>it is not an exhaustive list of all the duties, accountabilities, or skills required for the position. </strong><p><br></p>The general job duties, accountabilities and physical requirements associated with the position are subject to modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Some physical requirements may exclude individuals who pose a threat or risk to the health or safety to themselves or others.<p><br></p>This job description neither states nor implies that the listed general job duties, accountabilities, and physical requirements associated with the position are the only tasks expected of an employee. An employee is also required to follow any other job-related instructions and perform any other job-related tasks requested by their supervisor and not in violation of any applicable laws, regulations, or rules.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities</strong>. To perform this job successfully, an employee must possess the abilities and aptitude to perform each duty, accountability, and physical requirement proficiently.<p><br></p><strong>Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with Pinnacle in the U.S. is required and the company will not pursue Visa sponsorship for this position.</strong><p><br></p>Pinnacle participates in E-Verify, a federal government system used to verify employment authorization and social security number of each new employee.<p><br></p><em>Pinnacle is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, sex, age, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.</em>

title: SharePoint Developer
description: 3 days Onsite ***/hybrid in Chicago or Richardson<br>  <br>  Open Bid<br>  <br>  Job Description Summary: This position is responsible for developing, integrating, testing, and maintaining existing and new applications around FACETS system using multiple tools and technologies, processes.<br>  <br>  <br>  Job Description<br>  <br>  * Engage with business for discovery and requirements analysis for building FACETS integration components for different LOBs.<br>  * Participate in EPIC grooming sessions with business analysts and other stake holders.<br>  * Create well-articulated detailed design documents for the integration components.<br>  * Analysis, design, development, testing and support of the FACETS integration components.<br>  * Write well designed, testable, efficient code to support varied and more complex IT solutions<br>  * Technical expertise and collaborate with other IT stake holders/teams to deliver solutions that meet constantly changing business needs.<br>  * Be proactive in cutover, implementation and post production in identifying issues and addressing on time to remediate business critical issues.<br>  * Willing to learn new tools and technologies as needed.<br>  * Working with junior team members and provide direction as neeeded.<br>  <br>  <br>  Required Job Qualifications:<br>  <br>  * Good understanding on core FACETS V5.X with Members, Providers, Claims, Benefits, FACETS Open Access APIs knowledge.<br>  * Strong FACETS ABF understanding and building FACETS batch jobs using ABF.<br>  * Strong Microsoft SQL, PL/SQL and SSIS knowledge.<br>  * Strong .NET development skills.<br>  * Solid Data integration experience with FACETS data models.<br>  * Nice to have Mulesoft 4.X API management experience. Willing to learn Mulesoft API management product.<br>  * Understanding of networks, load balancers, and routing mechanics<br>  * Strong integration knowledge and experience in using LDAP, SAML/LTPA tokens, X.509 Certificates, Kerberos, WS-Security, and OAuth and applying OSWAP Top Ten<br>  * Must have implemented critical integration projects to production for major corporations<br>  * Knowledge in CICD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) tools including GIT, Jenkins, Maven.<br>  * Knowledge of Cloud computing / SaaS / IaaS / PaaS technologies<br>  * Service Oriented Architecture - SOAP / REST<br>  * Messaging/streaming technologies  IBM MQ, Kafka, etc.<br>  * SDLC Methodology - Agile / Scrum / Iterative Development<br>  * System Performance management &amp; experience in solution architecture.<br>  * Conceptual and creative thinking<br>  * Problem solving and analytical thinking<br>  * Strong oral/written communication skills<br>  * Mentoring and guiding other junior members of the team.

title: INFORMATICA DEVELOPER
description: <strong>Innovate here. And see your ideas come to life.<br><br></strong>It's an exciting time to work in tech at Edward Jones. We are making massive investments in emerging technologies to improve how we work with our clients and with each other. Relationships are the focus of our business model. And working in Technology here means using your skills to build, deliver and maintain the technologies that enable us to deepen and support those relationships. The best part? We develop and create our own industry-leading solutions internally. And you can be a part of it. Working with emerging new technologies. Creating platforms, programs and experiences that change how we work together - and support our client-first focus. Changing the future of our firm, the industry and the advisor-client relationship.<br><br><strong><u>Job Overview<br><br></u></strong>Position Schedule: Full-Time<br><br><strong><u>Team Overview<br><br></u></strong>We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced SIEM Engineer with expertise in Cribl and Infrastructure performance. As a SIEM Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of our Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system. You will support and manage Sentinel and the entire SIEM dev stack, and be responsible for proactive monitoring of log sources, onboarding of new log sources, and assist with new searches and additional capabilities as needed. In tandem with security leadership, this role consistently assesses the threat landscape and adapts quickly to protect the business from risk. They must be highly technical and possesses at least 3-5+ years' experience in security across a wide variety of security domains to include governance and compliance, cloud security architecture, with knowledge of software as a service (SaaS), infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and platform as a service (PaaS).<br><br><strong><u>What You'll Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design, implement, and maintain our SIEM system using Sentinel.</li><li>Design, implement, and maintain our log ingestion capabilities using Cribl.</li><li>Monitor and analyze availability, capacity, and performance</li><li>Help identify and onboard new data/log sources that increase security visibility against use cases</li><li>Collaborate with other security and IT teams to implement security best practices and ensure the security of our systems and data.</li><li>Manage and maintain SIEM infrastructure and software, including upgrades and patches.</li><li>Provide training and support to other teams on the use of Sentinel and SIEM best practices.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skills<br><br></u></strong>The salary range for this role is based on national data and actual pay is based on skills, experience, education, and other relevant factors for a potential new associate<br><br>At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing.<br><br>Hiring Minimum: $92984<br><br>Hiring Maximum: $158325<br><br><strong><u>Skills/Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>What You'll Need:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Telecommunications or Engineering preferred or related work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 7 years of experience directly related to technical area of expertise</li><li>Strong experience with Cribl and Sentinel, including deployment, configuration, and administration</li><li>Experience with security event correlation and analysis, incident response, and forensic analysis.</li><li>Knowledge of security threats, including malware, hacking techniques, and attack vectors.</li><li>Strong knowledge of networking, security protocols, and firewalls.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills.</li><li>Experience with Cribl is desirable but not required.<br></li></ul><strong>Awards &amp; Accolades</strong><ul><li>100 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2022, published Fortune July 2022, Great Places to Work® data as of March 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones was recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Millennials by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. The privately held firm ranked No. 2 overall, in its fourth appearance on the list.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, published September 2022, research by Great Places to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>Edward Jones has been named to the 2022 Best Workplaces for Women list by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine, ranking No. 45.</li></ul><li>2022 Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For, published April 2022, research by Great Place to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li>For the 23rd time, Edward Jones has earned a spot on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® ranking by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. Edward Jones ranked No. 35 on the prestigious 2022 list.</li><li>2022 Best Places to Work For LGBTQ+ Equality, Great Place to Work® in partnership with Human Rights Campaign Foundation, published Equity Magazine January 2022, data as of July 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.</li><ul><li> Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.<br></li></ul></ul></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.<br><br>In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.<br><br>Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.<br><br>Anne Schwabe<br><br>

title: Project Engineer
description: <em>Work From Anywhere in the U.S. - Remote </em><p><br></p><strong>Level Ex</strong> is a fast-growing game studio that creates <strong>video games for doctors.</strong><p><br></p>Our games feature thrilling medical cases built with the highest standards of game design and deliberate game mechanics. They also employ state-of-the-art graphics and physics technology, supported by the latest generation tech, allowing us to craft breathtaking virtual anatomy: custom-built GPU-based fluids, tissues, and soft-body systems that look and react like the real deal.<p><br></p>We attract top artists, engineers, and designers from prominent gaming franchises, like <em>Mortal Kombat</em>, <em>Halo, Call of Duty</em>, <em>Dragonvale, Star Wars, </em>and many others. Our caliber of talent keeps us at the forefront of the industry: GDC ranked our game design talk #2 of 194 for sponsored sessions in 2019, and we earned 2nd place at SIGGRAPH Real-Time Live! 2019, sharing the stage with Epic, Unity, Digital Domain, and others. Meet some of our incredible team here, and learn why you'll enjoy our company and culture - Video: Why Join Level Ex?<p><br></p>We're now looking for a<strong> Software Engineer</strong> to join our team. Reporting to our Lead Senior Software Engineer, you'll work on client projects for new and existing games collaborating with teammates from Engineering, Game Design, Artists, Production, Medical, Product Management and other teams to help advance the practice of medicine through play.<p><br></p><strong>What You'll Do</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implement, debug, and reﬁne gameplay through prototyping and iterative game development</li><li>Work closely with other Engineers, Game Designers, Artists, Producers, Product Managers, Medical Staff, and others to identify technical risks and implement solutions</li><li>Work closely with Engineers, Game Designers, Art, Production, Product Managers, QA, Medical Research, and Marketing teams to implement solutions, timelines, build reviews, technical risks, and testing</li><li>Write clean, professional, and maintainable code within our existing games</li><li>Research and use different technologies, SDKs, game engines, and architectures </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Who We Want To Meet</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 3+ years of professional experience working in a game development studio or software development environment</li><li>One or more commercially released games or mobile applications</li><li>Solid experience working in Unity3D or Unreal Engine</li><li>Fluency in C#</li><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and experience</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills</li><li>Proficiency with algorithms, design patterns, and data structure design</li><li>Experience across multiple aspects of game development such as character control, physics, game logic, asset loading, scoring, analytics, etc. </li><li>Proficiency with source control tools, like Perforce</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Deep experience working in Unity3D or Unreal Engine </li><li>Excellent 3D math skills</li><li>Experience with continuous integration and Jenkins</li><li>Experience working in Atlassian JIRA</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How We Make You Happy</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Multiple health insurance plans, one with 100% company-paid premiums at all levels</li><li>401(k) with a generous company-paid match</li><li>Family-friendly benefits; 4 weeks of PTO, 2 weeks of company holidays, dental, vision, optional pet insurance, and more!</li><li>In-person and remote-friendly events, i.e., board games tabletop simulator, Jackbox Games, DEI events, game jams, virtual happy hours</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Interested? </strong><p><br></p>Please send us your resume along with an optional cover letter detailing why you're an excellent fit using the links below. We look forward to hearing from you and exploring the possibilities.<p><br></p><strong>Equal Opportunity Statement (EEO)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Level Ex </strong>is the collective sum of all our individual experiences, backgrounds, and influences, and we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, (or related medical conditions, including, but not limited to lactation), physical disability, mental and/or intellectual disability, age, military status or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender identity or expression, medical condition, genetic information, or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Our commitment to inclusion across identity and experience drives us forward every day.<p><br></p><em>No Agency or Recruiter submissions will be accepted.</em><p><br></p><em>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required.</em><p><br></p><strong>Socials </strong><p><br></p><strong>Twitter</strong><strong>,</strong> <strong>LinkedIn</strong><strong>,</strong> <strong>Facebook</strong><strong>,</strong> <strong>YouTube</strong><p><br></p><strong>Please be aware of scammers impersonating Level Ex recruiters. All email correspondence regarding jobs with Level Ex will come from a <strong>level-ex.com email address</strong>. If being contacted by someone with a levelex.works or levelex.careers email address it is fraudulent - please do not respond.</strong><p><br></p>

title: Developer - Lead
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Infosys is seeking <strong>ServiceNow Developer</strong>. This role requires close partnership and collaboration with other Business Stakeholders and Subject Matter Experts. Essential Job Duties include working on complex ServiceNow ITSM modules, DevOps modules, Integration with other DevOps tools, deployments and integrations aligned to Industry best practices and translating functional &amp; technical requirements into implementation work package. Should be able to interact with the different architecture, platforms, application and infrastructure teams to understand and design the solution.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Chicago, IL, or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel in the US</li><li> Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education</li><li> At least 4 years of Information Technology experience</li><li> 2 years of experience in implementing IT Service Management, ITIL processes and Enterprise Service Management.</li><li> Experience in Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment</li><li> Experience in capturing requirements related to internal/external consulting, documenting, and mapping current business process</li><li> Working knowledge in all aspects of ServiceNow Applications development and Rest API based integrations with 3rd party applications</li><li> Experience in working with multi-vendor development environment</li><li> ServiceNow DevOps Module Administration for Automated Change Creation.</li><li> Provide support for ServiceNow issues including the issue related to ServiceNow DevOps Module</li><li> Administrating ServiceNow REST APIs</li><li> ServiceNow Reporting</li><li> U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor this time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent Communications and client interaction skills along with exceptional written and verbal skills as well as technical documentation</li><li> Must be well-organized, be able to work independently, and have strong ability to effectively multi-task and problem solving</li><li> Maintain high customer service levels by effectively working with team members, other internal organizations, vendors, and customers</li><li> Extraordinary Planning, Project Management, Coordination, and Analytical skills</li><li> Hands-on experience in working in Global Delivery Model with onsite/offshore resources</li><li> Ability to work in the Offshore and Onshore model</li><li> Must be able to work in highly dynamic environment of project deliverable</li><li> Exceptional Organizational Skills</li><li> Ability to manage and prioritize tasks efficiently</li><li> Readiness to demonstrate a proactive attitude</li><li> Integrate ServiceNow with other DevOps Tools like GitHub Actions, Azure Boards as part of ServiceNow DevOps Module Administration</li><li> Certified ServiceNow Implementation Specialist, ITIL is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email, or face to face.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. description_json: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Infosys is seeking <strong>ServiceNow Developer</strong>. This role requires close partnership and collaboration with other Business Stakeholders and Subject Matter Experts. Essential Job Duties include working on complex ServiceNow ITSM modules, DevOps modules, Integration with other DevOps tools, deployments and integrations aligned to Industry best practices and translating functional &amp; technical requirements into implementation work package. Should be able to interact with the different architecture, platforms, application and infrastructure teams to understand and design the solution.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Chicago, IL, or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel in the US</li><li> Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education</li><li> At least 4 years of Information Technology experience</li><li> 2 years of experience in implementing IT Service Management, ITIL processes and Enterprise Service Management.</li><li> Experience in Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment</li><li> Experience in capturing requirements related to internal/external consulting, documenting, and mapping current business process</li><li> Working knowledge in all aspects of ServiceNow Applications development and Rest API based integrations with 3rd party applications</li><li> Experience in working with multi-vendor development environment</li><li> ServiceNow DevOps Module Administration for Automated Change Creation.</li><li> Provide support for ServiceNow issues including the issue related to ServiceNow DevOps Module</li><li> Administrating ServiceNow REST APIs</li><li> ServiceNow Reporting</li><li> U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor this time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent Communications and client interaction skills along with exceptional written and verbal skills as well as technical documentation</li><li> Must be well-organized, be able to work independently, and have strong ability to effectively multi-task and problem solving</li><li> Maintain high customer service levels by effectively working with team members, other internal organizations, vendors, and customers</li><li> Extraordinary Planning, Project Management, Coordination, and Analytical skills</li><li> Hands-on experience in working in Global Delivery Model with onsite/offshore resources</li><li> Ability to work in the Offshore and Onshore model</li><li> Must be able to work in highly dynamic environment of project deliverable</li><li> Exceptional Organizational Skills</li><li> Ability to manage and prioritize tasks efficiently</li><li> Readiness to demonstrate a proactive attitude</li><li> Integrate ServiceNow with other DevOps Tools like GitHub Actions, Azure Boards as part of ServiceNow DevOps Module Administration</li><li> Certified ServiceNow Implementation Specialist, ITIL is a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email, or face to face.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>About This Role<br><br>Company is currently looking for a Senior Front End Engineer with experience in React and Next.js for contract position. The ideal candidate is someone who has extensive responsive web application development experience; has advanced technical skills in a production environment; and a solid understanding of best practices when designing and maintaining front end architectures. Market compensation for the ideal candidate. Full time work location may be remote.<br><br>Required Knowledge:<br><ul><li> React 18</li><li> Next.js 12+</li><li> Redux</li><li> TypeScript 4+</li><li> CSS (without applying a library such as Tailwind)<br><br></li></ul>Ideal Knowledge:<br><ul><li> Ant Design</li><li> Redux Toolkit</li><li> i18next</li><li> SCSS</li><li> Responsive/mobile web app experience<br><br></li></ul>To be successful in this role, you will need:<br><ul><li> 5 years professional experience, or equivalent combination of post grad education and/or internship experience</li><li> Experience collaborating effectively with a variety of business and engineering stakeholders</li><li> Demonstrated desire for continuous learning, improvement, and innovation</li><li> Passion for growth, sales, and company expansion</li><li> Relevant degree/training with strong technical component<br><br></li></ul>

title: ServiceNow Developer
description: <ul><li>Largest sports tech platform used by over 4M youth athletes across the nation|Excellent company culture working on greenfield development <br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>The client focuses on Youth Sports and Development. The offer a robust platform that organizes national events, practice and game schedules as well as individual athletes data. Having experienced tremendous growth in recent years they are looking for a Senior Front End Developer to play a key role in continuing to grow their platform.<br><br>They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports team in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M on boarded users. They have a clear career path with a chance to grow within the company to a managerial or leader role. They develop greenfield projects designed to enhance the experience of youth athletes and simplify the process of scheduling and making payments for their parents.<br><br>This is a hybrid opportunity with commute to the office required once a week.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Work with developers working in JavaScript/HTML/CSS (React.Js preferred but not required) - with the opportunity to jump in and code wherever necessary.</li><li>Translate business requirements or needs into actionable software development roadmaps and architecture.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Participate in discussions involving future developments, gaps in technology, external vendors and managing current software vendors.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Perform daily stand ups with team members to ensure optimal success and efficiency.</li><li>Take charge of development team without needing micromanagement from upper leadership.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>7+ years of progressive experience in software development</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Strong proficiency with JavaScript/HTML/CSS (React.JS preferred but not required).</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li><li>Interest in a hybrid model in the Highland Park office up to twice a week.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Salary ranging from $140k-$175k</li><li>On-boarding period to help the transition run smoothly</li><li>401k with 4% company match. No waiting period for matching</li><li>Strong health/dental/vision packages offered</li><li>Unlimited PTO with flex time</li><li>Collaborative team environment</li><li>Unlimited growth potential with career path laid out</li><li>Performance bonus and equity.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Connor Whitman<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6101295</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

description: <strong>Job#: 1330430</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>API Developer </strong></u><p><br></p><strong>Job Description: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is on the API Management team within Digital. The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.</li><li>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.</li><li>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.</li><li>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.</li><li>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features</li><li>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits 6. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team</li><li>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment.</li><li>Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.</li><li>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Typical Day</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development. Hybrid work, need to be at located at commutable distance from Chicago. There will be an in person interview.</li><li>Will be working with team members across the world virtually. Will also be interacting with team members in the Chicago office twice a week.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university. 2. 2+ years or more of software development experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills Required</strong>:<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway or similar.</li><li>Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.</li><li>Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity working in a Scrum environment</li><li>Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Hands on experience with metrics and visualization tools like Kibana, Grafana, or equivalent.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Soft Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal skills</li><li>Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints.</li><li>Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.</li><li>Must be reliable and proactive – able to work independently and meet deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. UnitedHealthcare creates and publishes the Transparency in Coverage Machine-Readable Files on behalf of Apex Systems.

title: Front End Developer - HYBRID - JavaScript (React.JS)
description: At CLA we create inspired careers.<br><br>We recognize that not everyone wants to grow their career in the same way. That’s why CLA exists to create opportunities. We promise to know you and help you.<br><br>CLA, one of the nation’s largest public accounting and professional services firm is currently seeking a<strong> Lead CRM Developer</strong> to join the growing IT organization team.<br><br><strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>The <strong>Lead CRM Developer</strong> brings their understanding of CRM processes, technology and data to help optimize and expand our existing and future technology stack, processes and people. The lead brings in extensive knowledge and use of Dynamics as a CRM platform along with experience with enhancing functionality through familiarity and use of Microsoft’s Power Platform and Microsoft Dataverse to drive and extend CLA back-office functionality. Finally, the Senior CRM Developer aligns closely with the Product Owner of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM database.<br><br><strong><u>The Lead CRM Developer Will</u></strong><ul><li>Lead the development of the Microsoft Dynamics CRM database to support the marketing technology stack and business processes as directed by the Marketing Technology Manager and CRM Product Owner. </li><li>Review and create CRM customizations including:</li><ul><li>Form/entity updates</li><li>Business process flows</li><li>Plugins</li><li>Javascript/HTML</li><li>PowerApps solutions</li><li>Power Automate flows</li><li>Custom HTML interfaces (web resources)</li><li>Data integrations/migrations</li><li>SQL updates</li><li>And various reporting technologies like Power BI and SSRS</li><li> Own processes driven and dependent on the Microsoft Dynamics CRM database, including support, maintenance, documentation, enablement, and enhancements.</li><li> Troubleshoot data integrity, errors, and Microsoft Dynamics CRM performance issues. Pressure testing of development for scalable solutions.</li><li> Partner with Product Owner, marketing automation team, analysts, and Marketing Technology Manager for developing reporting and streamlined business processes.</li><li> Act as a lead for developers and provide oversite and recommendations on development.</li><li> Act as a change agent by identifying and implementing appropriate improvements ensuring processes are automated and can scale at an enterprise level. This also includes staying current with technology and cloud trends.</li><li>Translate and design solutions for business requirements / user stories based on direction from Product Owner<br></li></ul><strong><u>The Ideal Candidate Has<br></u></strong><ul><li> At least 10 years of experience with CRM systems, MS Dynamics preferred. Five plus years in a developer role.</li><li> Experience with implementing third-party integrations into and out Microsoft Dynamics CRM, including a marketing automation platform.<br></li></ul><strong>Education <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or related field required.<br></li></ul>Equal Opportunity Employer /AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.<br><br>Click here to learn about your hiring rights.<br><br><strong>Wellness at CLA<br><br></strong>To support our CLA family members, we focus on their physical, financial, social, and emotional well-being and offer comprehensive benefit options that include health, dental, vision, 401k and much more.<br><br>To view a complete list of benefits click here.<br><br></ul>

title: DevOps Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Do you make complex technology look easy? So do we.<p><br></p>You know Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solutions do more than keep businesses running; they race them forward. We’ll surround you with people who as are passionate about technology and innovation as you are.<p><br></p><strong>About You</strong><p><br></p>You r in-depth understanding of how enterprise works enable you to create seamless solutions that build businesses. You’re a dedicated, analytical software developer who turns issues into improvements. You love put ting your skills to the test, offering new ideas for exciting transformation projects, and you enjoy guiding the full li fecycle of software development from analyzing requirements to delivering real solutions for clients.<p><br></p><strong>About The Job</strong><p><br></p>Enterprise Resource P lanning is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your clients’ challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions with Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations (F&amp;O). Y ou’ll design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing software systems. You’ll get to work on systems and applications for market sale, as well as large-scale proprietary software for our own use.<p><br></p>As an ERP Software Developer , you’ll:<p><br></p><ul><li> Use Dynamics F&amp;O to design, develop, document, test, and debug new modules and extensions. </li><li> Write technical specifications based on conceptual designs and business requirements. </li><li> Identify and evaluate new technologies for implementation. </li><li> Support colleagues in tracing during prototyping </li></ul><p><br></p>Your skills<p><br></p>You’re a flexible manager who can switch between projects and processes and reshape work plans – all the while maintaining focus and supporting your team. You love an informal environment where you can use your initiative and judgment to direct your own work and that of your team . You understand how businesses work inside and out , and pair your proven technical capabilities with your great interpersonal skills to offer both technical and operational support and mentorship .<p><br></p><strong> Your experience includes: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Working with Microsoft Dynamics AX or F&amp;O </li><li> 4+ years of X++ Development </li><li> A solid grasp of organi z ational policies and process </li><li> A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field </li><li> Six to eight years of professional experience </li><li> Mentor ing and s upporting junior colleagues , and supervising project teams . </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Avanade</strong><p><br></p>Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.<p><br></p>We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.<p><br></p>We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.<p><br></p>Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

title: APIGEE Developer
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Retail Business Services, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Greenville Data Center - It (5118626)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>Platform Reliability Engineer will help ensure service availability, identifying and automating manual processes, and bridging the gaps between product development teams and operations. Implementing operational improvements in availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitorChriing, incident response, patch management and capacity planning are all within scope for this role. Whether it's done through code, the introduction of modern tools, and/or better processes continuous improvement and efficiency is the goal.<p><br></p>You'll provide operational excellence with troubleshooting skills, ownership in supporting various Azure services<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Builds, manages, and operate Azure Core Services with automation and infrastructure as code</li><li> Manages, and operates the continuous delivery framework and tools, manages, and automates the lifecycle of the different platform components and help support product teams</li><li> Leverage cloud architecture, applying site reliability principles, full-stack troubleshooting skills across network, application, security, Identity, OS, Containers, on-prem, and distributed services layers.</li><li> Lead and set strategy, roadmap for cloud reliability and recommend best practices for Operations</li><li> Mentor the team members to follow the frameworks and guide them to accelerate delivery of projects</li><li> Provide reasoning about system &amp; application architecture as well as be comfortable looking at code and offering feedback on how it can be improved to increase reliability.</li><li> Identify opportunities and drive the implementation of automation to improve patch management, service health, manageability, reliability, and telemetry.</li><li> Own, triage, investigate and resolve service issues with an emphasis on broad communications, learning &amp; teaching throughout the process</li><li> Design process or technology solutions that monitor, identify, and resolve platform, system, deployment, and environmental issues both prior &amp; post production releases, and ensure measurable improvements against Service KPIs.</li><li> Drive Security and compliance aspects for services in accordance with Azure compliance requirements.</li><li> Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting and work towards Azure cost optimizations.</li><li> Create and document Runbooks, Operational procedures, and Standards on confluence</li><li> Communicate on a deeply technical level with product engineering, project management and product teams to improve and optimize products, improve infrastructure, and evolve services.</li><li> Work within a project management/agile scrum teams in a support role as part of a wider team</li><li> Remain current on new technologies, methods and procedures including, but not limited to, coding practices such as Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and Operational excellence/</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field</li><li> 8+ years of IT experience focused on infrastructure which includes server, storage, network, security, Identity</li><li> 4+ years of experience supporting, maintaining, and automating Azure environments</li><li> 3+ years of experience using IaC tools (ARM, Terraform, JSON,YAML, PowerShell, Github etc...)</li><li> Production experience in Cloud technologies - Azure IaaS, PaaS, networking, Azure functions, Azure automation and runbooks, workbooks, Insights, Security center, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics.</li><li> Ability to read, write, configure, design, and script end-to-end service telemetry, alerting and self-healing capabilities for platform services, lead the execution and ongoing management of services</li><li> Ability to work in an Extreme Programming environment and work in a paired programming/operating model, able to lead the team and help remove roadblocks</li><li> Able to facilitate diverse teams, multi-task, and work under pressure to meet aggressive schedule targets</li><li> Hands on experience with IaC tools like ADO, ARM, terraform, ansible, PowerShell, python, azcli, github</li><li> Experience in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning</li><li> Technical and Operational expertise in Windows/Linux/VMware/Hyper-V/AKS, SQL and N0-SQL DB's, IaaS, PaaS, FaaS, Data, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, Monitoring, Identity and Connectivity</li><li> Experience managing and maintaining code repos, build systems, and CICD pipelines</li><li> Experience in infrastructure and configuration as code, as well as service auto-scale capabilities.</li><li> Worked in Devops and Agile environments, Blend of both Development and SRE mindset</li><li> Systematic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.</li><li> Participate in on call rotation. Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li>Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li>Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li>Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li>Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li>Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake/</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certification in Azure Administrator -required, Azure DevOps -preferred, Azure Solutions Architect -preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>LI-RV1 #DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at .<p><br></p>For more information, visit .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306572_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023 Cloud Reliability Engineer<p><br></p>

title: Lead Dynamics CRM Developer
description: It is an exciting time to be part of the PatientPoint team! As the clear leader in the point-of-care industry, we offer an ideal, people-focused place to <strong>innovate</strong>, positively <strong>impact</strong> patient education and doctor-patient connections, and <strong>be</strong> <strong>inspired</strong> to build a great career.<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago/Hybrid<br><br><strong>Hybrid Schedule:</strong> 2 days in office / 3 days at home weekly<br><br><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>PatientPoint is looking for a Test Automation Engineer to join our Quality Assurance (QA) organization and play an integral role in building out the test automation services. You will be testing our embedded mobile applications and developing test automation for our products in the enterprise, mobile, or healthcare space. You’ll work with all aspects of the product and platform development, including collaborating with hardware, media content, and design engineering teams to test and automate test scripts for our products.<br><br>The Test Automation Engineer plays an essential role in ensuring the quality of products and platforms. The primary responsibility will be to work in partnership with developers, product management, and QA Team to define, design, and execute testing, build or modify the automation framework. You will develop a deep understanding of our products and the complex use cases to test them. You will also create a robust set of automated tests that will result in a deep and flexible set of tests that become the primary foundation of our regression deployment and continuous delivery testing.<br><br><strong>What You’ll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with Product Owners/BA’s/Architects/QA Testers in refinement and defining story acceptance criteria for controls-based software utilized in automated systems for material movement.</li><li>Analyze system requirements and review technical specifications to assess, evaluate, and create testing requirements for all software components for functional and end-to-end scenarios.</li><li>Follows best practices for construction and utilization of Hybrid Testing Framework (data-driven, Keyword Driven) to support Dev and DevOps in Test/Behavior-driven designs and DevOps CI/CD pipelines for test automation/integration.</li><li>Collaborate and contribute to automation test system architecture, methodologies, and processes using industry best practices and innovation of testing framework.</li><li>Design, construct and maintain automated test reporting infrastructure for providing technical, project, and business visibility to software quality.</li><li>Works as a multi-skilled professional practicing SAFe Agile in both a SCRUM/Kanban methodology.</li><li>Taking part in continuous improvement through sharing of knowledge and coaching within the team.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Need<br></strong><ul><li>4+ years of total professional experience</li><li>2+ years of experience in software testing and test automation of Android applications</li><li>2+ years of experience working in Agile projects</li><li>2+ years of experience with Python and JavaScript</li><li>1+ years of experience with Appium</li><li>Expertise implementing Automation Frameworks like TDD/BDD, Keyword, POM, and Hybrid Frameworks (e.g., Selenium)</li><li>Experience with test automation tools like Robot Framework, Selenium, TestNG, Cucumber</li><li>Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.)</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs testing</li><li>Experience with SQL language in one or more database platforms (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or MS SQL)</li><li>Hands-on experience with PyCharm or other IDE development tools</li><li>Experience with distributed source control systems such as Git</li><li>Experience in requirements gathering, designing test plans, defect management, project tracking, reporting, and End of Test report creation</li><li>Integration of testing controls into CI/CD pipeline and within release management processes</li><li>Experience with test runners reporting and linking into Continuous Integration (CI) servers such as Jenkins, Travis or CircleCI</li><li>Experience testing cloud-based software with domain-driven designs utilizing Docker and Kubernetes<br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree</li><li>Experience in software testing of embedded Android applications</li><li>Knowledge of Linux, ssh, ADB and shell scripting</li><li>Experience with Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure</li><li>Certification with TMAP and/or ISTQB<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Need To Succeed<br></strong><ul><li>Self-motivation, strong ambition, and interest in directly impacting business results.</li><li>Resourcefulness, multi-tasking skills and creative problem-solving skills.</li><li>Curiosity and a strong passion for data, trend analysis and storytelling through data.</li><li>Resiliency and ability to overcome challenges, sound business judgment.</li><li>Passion for relationship building and building trusted partnerships.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong>We know you bring your whole self to work every day. That is why we are committed to providing modernized benefits and cultural perks to our teammates. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive and affordable benefits, flex time off to rest and charge, where applicable, a hybrid work model, mental &amp; emotional wellness resources and coaching, 401K and more.<br><br><strong>About PatientPoint<br><br></strong>PatientPoint® is the patient engagement platform for every point of care. Our innovative, tech-enabled solutions create more effective doctor-patient interactions and deliver high value for patients, providers and healthcare sponsors. Through our nearly 140k unique healthcare provider relationships, PatientPoint’s solutions impact roughly 750 million patient visits each year, further advancing our mission of making every doctor-patient engagement better®. Learn more at patientpoint.com.<br><br><em>PatientPoint recognizes that privacy is important to you. Please read the PatientPoint privacy policy, we want you to be familiar with how we may collect, use, and disclose your information. Employer is EOE/M/F/D/V</em>
description_json: It is an exciting time to be part of the PatientPoint team! As the clear leader in the point-of-care industry, we offer an ideal, people-focused place to <strong>innovate</strong>, positively <strong>impact</strong> patient education and doctor-patient connections, and <strong>be</strong> <strong>inspired</strong> to build a great career.<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago/Hybrid<br><br><strong>Hybrid Schedule:</strong> 2 days in office / 3 days at home weekly<br><br><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>PatientPoint is looking for a Test Automation Engineer to join our Quality Assurance (QA) organization and play an integral role in building out the test automation services. You will be testing our embedded mobile applications and developing test automation for our products in the enterprise, mobile, or healthcare space. You’ll work with all aspects of the product and platform development, including collaborating with hardware, media content, and design engineering teams to test and automate test scripts for our products.<br><br>The Test Automation Engineer plays an essential role in ensuring the quality of products and platforms. The primary responsibility will be to work in partnership with developers, product management, and QA Team to define, design, and execute testing, build or modify the automation framework. You will develop a deep understanding of our products and the complex use cases to test them. You will also create a robust set of automated tests that will result in a deep and flexible set of tests that become the primary foundation of our regression deployment and continuous delivery testing.<br><br><strong>What You’ll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with Product Owners/BA’s/Architects/QA Testers in refinement and defining story acceptance criteria for controls-based software utilized in automated systems for material movement.</li><li>Analyze system requirements and review technical specifications to assess, evaluate, and create testing requirements for all software components for functional and end-to-end scenarios.</li><li>Follows best practices for construction and utilization of Hybrid Testing Framework (data-driven, Keyword Driven) to support Dev and DevOps in Test/Behavior-driven designs and DevOps CI/CD pipelines for test automation/integration.</li><li>Collaborate and contribute to automation test system architecture, methodologies, and processes using industry best practices and innovation of testing framework.</li><li>Design, construct and maintain automated test reporting infrastructure for providing technical, project, and business visibility to software quality.</li><li>Works as a multi-skilled professional practicing SAFe Agile in both a SCRUM/Kanban methodology.</li><li>Taking part in continuous improvement through sharing of knowledge and coaching within the team.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Need<br></strong><ul><li>4+ years of total professional experience</li><li>2+ years of experience in software testing and test automation of Android applications</li><li>2+ years of experience working in Agile projects</li><li>2+ years of experience with Python and JavaScript</li><li>1+ years of experience with Appium</li><li>Expertise implementing Automation Frameworks like TDD/BDD, Keyword, POM, and Hybrid Frameworks (e.g., Selenium)</li><li>Experience with test automation tools like Robot Framework, Selenium, TestNG, Cucumber</li><li>Experience with Atlassian tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.)</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs testing</li><li>Experience with SQL language in one or more database platforms (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, or MS SQL)</li><li>Hands-on experience with PyCharm or other IDE development tools</li><li>Experience with distributed source control systems such as Git</li><li>Experience in requirements gathering, designing test plans, defect management, project tracking, reporting, and End of Test report creation</li><li>Integration of testing controls into CI/CD pipeline and within release management processes</li><li>Experience with test runners reporting and linking into Continuous Integration (CI) servers such as Jenkins, Travis or CircleCI</li><li>Experience testing cloud-based software with domain-driven designs utilizing Docker and Kubernetes<br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree</li><li>Experience in software testing of embedded Android applications</li><li>Knowledge of Linux, ssh, ADB and shell scripting</li><li>Experience with Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure</li><li>Certification with TMAP and/or ISTQB<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Need To Succeed<br></strong><ul><li>Self-motivation, strong ambition, and interest in directly impacting business results.</li><li>Resourcefulness, multi-tasking skills and creative problem-solving skills.</li><li>Curiosity and a strong passion for data, trend analysis and storytelling through data.</li><li>Resiliency and ability to overcome challenges, sound business judgment.</li><li>Passion for relationship building and building trusted partnerships.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong>We know you bring your whole self to work every day. That is why we are committed to providing modernized benefits and cultural perks to our teammates. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive and affordable benefits, flex time off to rest and charge, where applicable, a hybrid work model, mental &amp; emotional wellness resources and coaching, 401K and more.<br><br><strong>About PatientPoint<br><br></strong>PatientPoint® is the patient engagement platform for every point of care. title: Dynamics 365 F&O Developer
description: Description:<br>    <br>    ASAP Start. Will work in office<br>    work posture of 3 days in office and 2 days’ work from home.<br>    <br>    Please do not submit candidates there were submitted on BACJP00199383<br>    <br>    Job Title: Exchange Traded Derivatives Operations Transformation and Change Analyst<br>    <br>    Who we are:<br>    <br>    Global Collateral Operations &amp; Exchange Traded Derivatives Operations (GCO &amp; ETD Ops) are responsible for the exchange of collateral to reduce counterparty credit risk and for the support of post-execution trade clearing and product lifecycle management. Our global team consists of a diverse pool of over 500 individuals spanning 16 cities across 7 countries. We provide front-to back support for a broad range of Clients (hedge funds, market makers, trading firms, advisers and investment banks), Global Market products and businesses including:<br>    • Futures and Options &amp; OTC Cleared (F&amp;O)<br>    • Prime Brokerage (PB)<br>    • Global Wealth &amp; Investment Management (GWIM)<br>    • OTC Bi-lateral Derivatives (OTC)<br>    <br>    ETD Operations supports:<br>    • Execution, clearing and allocation of trades and position transfers to the highest quality standards<br>    • Futures and Options position life cycle management including Corporate Action and Credit Event processing, Open Interest reporting and Exercise, Assignment and Deliveries<br>    • Daily Reconciliations and exception resolution, maintaining the integrity of the sub ledger for Listed and OTC Futures and Options product<br>    • Non-Financial Regulatory Reporting to Futures Exchanges and Regulators<br>    • Ensuring compliance with regulatory and industry mandates across 15 Legal Entities<br>    • Production of reports and information required to comply with regulatory requirements and internal control policies<br>    • Researching and resolving problems within the line of business<br>    • Day-to-day analysis, research, and resolution of varied problems<br>    <br>    The Team:<br>    <br>    The ETD Operations Clearing Infrastructure Solutions and Strategy team drives and facilitates the change agenda for Futures and Options and OTC Cleared Operations. The team works with ETD BAU teams based in Chicago, Charlotte, Chester, London and Singapore, other Operations teams, Front Office partners and Technology to deliver Enterprise and Regulatory change programs, new business ideas and operational excellence improvements ensuring cross product and efficient solutions are delivered with no impact to risk or stability. ETD Operations have embarked on an ambitious program to refresh their end-to-end technology platforms.<br>    <br>    Role Description:<br>    <br>    • Product high quality program reporting for Managing Director including capture and maintaining projects in *** program management tool. Present program status in existing governance routines<br>    • Work with BAU teams to identify and agree user requirements for strategic Cleared Derivatives architecture solutions<br>    • Work with BAU teams to understand impact of Regulatory change and inform design of strategic solutions for implementation<br>    • For funded projects track UAT status including schedules, resourcing, environments, scripts, and results reporting<br>    • Provide ad hoc support across Change book of work<br>    Core Skills:<br>    <br>    • Experience of having worked on a change initiative with strategic deliverables required<br>    • Confident communicator who can convey complex messages to a wide audience and is adept at negotiating and navigating at all levels across an organisation<br>    • Instance credibility across ETD Experience of Exchange Traded Derivatives Execution or Clearing Operations, or previously worked in a supporting BAU process<br>    • Experience of using an Exchange Traded Derivatives clearing platform beneficial but not essential<br>    • Experience in driving process forward independently whilst seeking steer and guidance as and when necessary<br>    • Candidate should be intellectually curious and understand what drives processes

description: This is a Hybrid Position in Chicago. Candidate will need to go into Willis Tower once a week.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>As a React Developer, you will help lead the modernization of the client's website.<p><br></p>You will be responsible for writing efficient, testable, and reusable code using React and Redux.<p><br></p>We are looking for a developer who is passionate about writing the best quality code and has knowledge/experience across multiple technologies. A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.<p><br></p>This role will be working within an agile team environment building new features for Client.com and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.<p><br></p><strong><u>Heres What Youll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p>" Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain Clients technology standards<p><br></p>" Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges<p><br></p>" Perform code reviews and mentor your peers<p><br></p>" Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product<p><br></p>" Work in an Agile environment<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>" 5+ years of experience in software development<p><br></p>" 3+ years of expert level JavaScript experience with React, Redux, Webpack and ES6 or equivalent experience<p><br></p>" Experience in Source code repositories like Github<p><br></p>" Experience with end to end CI/CD solutions using platforms like TeamCity<p><br></p>" Experience with web application testing frameworks like Jest or Enzyme<p><br></p>" Understanding of complex large-scale application architecture<p><br></p>" Demonstrated technical leadership in a web application development team<p><br></p>" Excellent communication and people skills<p><br></p>" BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field or equivalent experience, education or training<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>" Expertise in performance optimization techniques<p><br></p>" Experience building rest api using .Net<p><br></p>" Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming<p><br></p>" Ability to create high level application architecture

A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.<p><br></p>This role will be working within an agile team environment building new features for Client.com and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.<p><br></p><strong><u>Heres What Youll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p>" Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain Clients technology standards<p><br></p>" Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges<p><br></p>" Perform code reviews and mentor your peers<p><br></p>" Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product<p><br></p>" Work in an Agile environment<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>" 5+ years of experience in software development<p><br></p>" 3+ years of expert level JavaScript experience with React, Redux, Webpack and ES6 or equivalent experience<p><br></p>" Experience in Source code repositories like Github<p><br></p>" Experience with end to end CI/CD solutions using platforms like TeamCity<p><br></p>" Experience with web application testing frameworks like Jest or Enzyme<p><br></p>" Understanding of complex large-scale application architecture<p><br></p>" Demonstrated technical leadership in a web application development team<p><br></p>" Excellent communication and people skills<p><br></p>" BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field or equivalent experience, education or training<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>" Expertise in performance optimization techniques<p><br></p>" Experience building rest api using .Net<p><br></p>" Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming<p><br></p>" Ability to create high level application architecture

title: .Net Developer
description: Contract | $70-80/hr | Chicago,IL<p><br></p>We are seeking an experienced Ruby on Rails Engineer to design and develop features for a consumer facing financial services website. This is a 6-month contract and fully remote. This industry leader in lending is looking to advance the financial standing of hardworking individuals. As their Ruby on Rails Engineer, you’ll be responsible for the design and development of new features and APIs. From scratch, you’ll help the team build, test, and scale sustainable solutions to new and existing problems. You can expect to spend time working with Ruby on Rails, React, Restful APIs, and SQL queries. The ideal candidate will have experience or familiarity with the financial services industry. Contract Duration: 6 Months Required Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of full-stack experience </li><li>4+ years of experience with Ruby on Rails </li><li>3+ years of experience with React and Restful APIs </li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience) </li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional startup environment</li></ul><p><br></p>Desired Skills &amp; Experience <ul><li>Experience in an enterprise environment </li><li>Experience running SQL queries </li><li>Experience working in the financial services industry </li><li>Strong voice and opinions regarding the proper way to build software</li></ul><p><br></p>What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown <ul><li>50% Backend </li><li>50% Frontend</li></ul><p><br></p>Daily Responsibilities <ul><li>80% Hands On </li><li>20% Team Collaboration </li></ul><p><br></p>Motion Recruitment Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including EOE Protected Veterans/Disability/Women. All applicants must be currently authorized to work on a full-time basis in the country for which they are applying, and no sponsorship is currently available. Employment is subject to the successful completion of a pre-employment background screening including a criminal check. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under Motion Recruitment Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.
